Forum Post: 
Post title: login page comes when trying to create uploaded file resource
Post description: On one machine here the teacher is thrown to the login page when trying to create a resource of type uploaded file. Everything proceeds as usual, including the uploading and choosing of the file. But then when the teacher clicks on "Save changes"  he is asked to log in again. This problem is not showing up on my machine. The teacher is using IE6 under Windows 2000. Does anyone have an idea what could be causing this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Gustav, I experienced this with earlier versions of Moodle 1.2x off and on while it was in beta (IE6+XP).  A few days ago while exploring build 2004042703 of version 1.3, that's all I experienced.  After a few hours of trying to determine what "might" be going on, I concluded that the HTML editor was probably the culprit.  In my case, a course uploaded that had a different moodledata storage path would 100% of the time cause the bounce to login screen problem, as soon as the HTML editor was fired up.  I suppose it was only doing what it thought it was supposed to be doing, as a file browser . It other words, if it was asked to load into its file manager window resources located somewhere in non-public storage, it would attempt to login to that Moodle site (hence the login screen).  In fact, I suspect that if you have any files/resources used in Moodle A, and stored in Moodle B, this problem may occur. The good news is that build 2004043001 (April 30th and later) seems to have fixed the problem.  Try as I might, I cannot get things to go south when I fire up the HTML editor, even with resources at another location.  The file manager simply displays an error message in the view pane on right, and then nicely lets you select a local Moodle resourse in the left view pane without sending you to the login screen.  A fairly stable build I'm finding, so far. As an aside, if your teacher has more than one cookie for the same Moodle site in their cache, this might also be a problem.  Have them flush browser cache while not logged in, and see if problem still persists.

Post title: new window display option
Post description: When I add a file (2.2.3) the Options/Display menu lists: Automatic, Embed, Force Download , Open, In pop-up. However the help button also lists New window, which is not available. Is there any way to enable this option?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi. I have exactly the same question? I am using Moodle 2.5 and have a PDF resource linked to a page and the Display menu list does not have the "New Window" option? If I click the Help button next to the Display menu list, it includes the "New Window" option?
Comment 2: Hi both Yes you need to enable it from the site first from Administration > Site Administration > Plugins > Activity modules > File . Then in available display options you also need to select New window as highlighted.
Comment 3: We have resolved Shane's request to have the option added to the list.. but there must be a reason it is not included in the default options. I vaguely remember reading about issues with IE and iPads when forcing display options. I believe that Automatic is the preferred option in most cases. What experiences are other admins having with mobiles and the new tab vs new window debate? @moodlemuse Klevar Group

Post description: Using dreamweaver to create web pages I upload to Moodle and link as a resource of the web page sort. But when I edit the page, whether in moodle via EDIT in html or in dreamweaver and then upload again, the displayed page stays static. Forum Post: 
Post title: Confirm a document has been read?
Post description: I ned to have a lsit of policy documents and have each user confirm that they have been read. Something like a Site Policy. Any one know of an easy way to achieve this?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: May I suggest you use a Lesson ? You can make each page in the Lesson a policy document, or part of a document. End each page with a question that has three answers, like: Choose one of the following: 1. I have read the document and want to continue to the next document [score 1 and jump to next page] 2. I have read the document and want to exit [score 1 and exit] 3. I have not read the document and want to exit [score 0 and exit] If the policy documents are long, break them up into multiple lessons. Make a page for each section. The end of lesson page can have a "congratulations you've finished this document" message and a link to download the pdf version of the document. And by default, when a student re-enters a Lesson, (s)he sees the last page or branch table that (s)he viewed. That's a nice feature to ensure continuity for your readers. You can also use the Certificate module to send an email to someone when the student completes the lesson (reads the entire document). See the discussion here http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=95672 . You can set up the Certificate module so that the student gets the certificate only after scoring 100% (reading all the sections ). See the "Lesson dependency trick" here http://docs.moodle.org/en/Certificate_module#Lesson_dependency_trick_1 . At this point you might be wondering, "How does displaying a certificate equal sending an email?" The answer is that you can set the Certificate module to email the certificate, to the student and the teacher. It's a workaround to get Moodle to send an email upon completion of a Lesson, but it gets the job done. Hope this helps. I'd be interested to hear the solution you finally go with.

Post title: Preventing wmv from automatically playing
Post description: I'm including links to 3 wmv files on a web page resource. When I open the page in Firefox all 3 start playing at once. Is there any way to prevent the files from auto starting?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, What version of Moodle are you using? I didnt know that wmv's could play through Moodle in Firefox, Chrome or Safari. It has been an issue for years. Has that been fixed? We cant get them to play at all in Moodle 1.9.5. Richard
Comment 2: I think it is a browser vs. Microsoft issue...not a Moodle issue.  You are trying to play a microsoft format video in a non-Microsoft browser. There's a Windows Media plugin for firefox that might help.  See the bottom of this page: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/browse/type:7
Comment 3: Here I am a year later! I had the probem mentionned above (wmv that starts playing). Then I tried with FLV, which is OK. I just installed the Windows Media plugin for Firefox and the problem is solved. Lesson : go for FLV otherwise you need to tell your users to install a plugin if they're not using IE .

Post title: Cannot Display PHP file from resource repository
Post description: Hi again, No-one has yet replied to my previous message, so I thought the best thing to do is to explain myself in more depth. When I link to normal HTML, PDF, TEXT etc, these files are displayed for my students. If I create a web link to a specific php file, eg href://www.cybertafe.com/somefolder/somefile.php , the file is displayed correctly. The problem is when I link to a php file from within the respository. The file is not executed, though the permissions are correct, and the code is displayed. eg. RESOURCES/WebDesign/somefile.php Please, is there any thing I may be overlooking that prevents the display of my files.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, I could be wrong, but I think files from the resources directories are treated differently, they are called by root/lib/filelib.php I think. Have a look at the settings in there, in my install it seems to be treating php resources as text files: 'php'  => array ('type'=>'text/plain', 'icon'=>'text.gif'), around line 77 Good luck
Comment 2: Thanks for the suggestion David, Tried a number of variation within the code to no avail. thanks anyway Mark
Comment 3: Also, have a care about security if you change this. An inappropriate bit of PHP code could blow the server security wide open.
Comment 4: I have the same problem (see my recent post). My solution was to place the php script in the moodle root directory. It works, but it is far from satisfactory (I don't know about security, but certainly for portability) It would be probably possible to make it work from the repository, but then it should be called by its absolute address (not by file.php/etc) and any reference to moodle files should by hard-wired into the script, which IMO is worst that having it in the root. I would be happy to read about a different solution Piersante

Forum Post: 
Post title: 1.8 Resource-Forced Summaries
Post description: I can't find any way to disable this in the Resource settings or the roles system, unless I'm just not finding this setting, it seems like a bug in 1.8 as this isn't mentioned as an intentional feature in the 1.8 release notes. http://docs.moodle.org/en/Category:Moodle_1.8 http://docs.moodle.org/en/Release_Notes#Moodle_1.8 Why folks might not want this as a feature: If you do a good job of writing a summary, it can take a good deal of time, and faculty like to do a good job on their courses. Many faculty feel that good summaries will act like "Cliff notes" the students will read the summaries and not read the full articles. It also is a big human resource hit for large sites-if you have 1000 faculty each now spending an extra 3 minutes per resource writing decent summaries, your total cost to run Moodle has just shot through the roof. Suggested solutions: There should be a way to turn this off in the Admin module config along with all the other settings that can be set for resources. Or even nicer, a new resource capability:imakeyousummarize, so that a single site could have some courses where summaries are forced and others where they are not. Anyway, think this is a bug as described above, so I've put it in the tracker as: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-9485

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sundeep If I understand both of these questions correctly you need to have a good look at Roles . The Admin can assign a user (teacher) as a Course Creator which provides that user with the ability to create a course and teach in it. The Admin can also assign users as teachers in a course then remove their access when not required (or provide them with a different role that is not as high as a teacher). Forum Post: 
Post title: How to Make an Illustrated Lecture
Post description: I just spent the afternoon playing around trying to create something that I will need for my courses, and that is a way to display illustrated lectures. I wanted a simple way to use the html editor within the resource module to create pages that otherwise look like plain text resources but with a column of images on the left side (which would display a "caption" on mouseover) and text on the right. I wanted the image column to stay a constant width, whereas I wanted the text to be able to be resized if the user resized his browser. Bryan Williams suggested to someone that they might use tables to reduce the width of text in the generaltextbox and this inspired me to use tables to create the effect I wanted as well. I have now created a "template" that simply requires entering the lecture text, the image paths and caption text into the html template. This could even be used offline and then the resulting html simply needs to be pasted into the editor. I have been doing all this with the test moodle account at opensourcecms.com since I don't have my own Moodle set up yet, so I can't show you an example of what it looks like, but I've attached the html with the usage instructions embedded if anyone is interested in playing around with it.

Post title: MP3 file resources, player does not show
Post description: Hi all, Since our upgrade to Moodle 3.10.8, we have noticed that there is something awry with file resource that have an MP3 file. Normally, when opening such a resource a page opens with a player on it, but lately the player is gone. Something is stopping the multimedia filters (Poodle and the regular multimedia filter) from working. MP3 flies that have been added to text editors and linked to do generate a player. I wonder if anyone else has (had) this same problem and if they have any suggestions as to how to solve it. Kind regards, Paul.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi all, I have now been able to narrow this issue down to specifically the File resource page when it opens automatically. When set to Open or to Pop up, the MP3 file plays. I discovered that this issue has to do with the Poodll filter, for when the Multimedia filter is raised above the Poodll filter in the Manage filters list, the problem goes away. I request that the moderator transfers this thread to the Poodll forum, so as to avoid double posting. Thanks, Paul.

Post title: Updating Resource
Post description: I tweak my moodle resource files (generally word documents) quite often. I find it cumbersome to go through the process of uploading and reassigning the file again each time I make a change to a file. Isn't there a way to open the resource file from within moodle make changes and save it directly back to the resource folder?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Interesting question. I suppose a good answer depends.. I don't know that MS has built ftp capabilities into their software, but you could essentially do the same thing instead of uploading by using a link for your resources to a file at say google shared documents. With this, you've work in your browser, log into your google account, edit as you wanted. This could even be a collaborative document. Then I wonder what's the big hassle about your ' upload ' process. Perhaps if you used something like Dreamweaver, which produces good html and also manages websites, in one click, your MSword document revision would be 'uploaded'. And, if you were willing to go with a simpler text editor rather than requiring all the formatting of the bloatware Word, you could probably use something like BBEdit (Mac) and open and edit your document on the server . Care, and probably not too helpful.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Post Resources, but Nothing Else??
Post description: I am looking for a way to have a user be able to post resources in a course, but not be able to "participate" in that course. For example, I am a member of a five person board and I would like to create a course where we can discuss or monthly meetings, collaborate on items, upload items, etc. I have set all that up in the topic format and am using a standard forum for our collaboration...this works great. However, I would like to have our secertary be able to post the meeting agenda and other documents to the course without actually being able to enter and read our forums. Is this possible without having the resources and forums in separate courses?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This sounds like something you would have to change the code a bit in order to do, but I'm sure it could be done. It probably would involve creating a new user type which had the priveleges you need.
Comment 2: Hi Steve, use groups, put your secretary in one group, she can post to an open forum. Put everyone else in another group, set the forums you want to post to to use separate groups. Now she could still post to these forums, but she won't be able to see your posts/dicussions. This isn't ideal, one thing we're working on is a block that should make controlled file sharing easier (see block_shared_files in CVS ).
Comment 3: Thanks Michael...I've been experimenting with setting up and using groups. Sounds like this may work for what I need. Steve

Post title: making resources to public
Post description: hi all, is there any way to allow guest to access resource folder (you can see resources under administration page)?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: resources on the start site (=id1) are public.
Comment 2: sorry, i don't get what you mean. can you elaborate? thanks
Comment 3: You can add a folder in the main menu on the startsite as ressource. This folder is then part of the ../moodledata/1/.. folder. If the guests can not see this folder check the permissions for the folder  ../moodledata/1/.... onthe server . They must be set to 0777.
Comment 4: If you are not able to access resource created for the site homepage, also check the setting in Admin->Config and check the "forcelogin" setting.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Failed to write file to disk Error
Post description: I am trying to add a resource "compose a web page" in that while uploading  a audio file through "insert link" i get this error saying "Failed to write file to disk" previously using this same method i had already uploaded 3- 4 audio files. But now its showing the same error for all audio files which i am trying to upload . Pl. require urgent help. (I am using moodle 1.9 version)
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, have you checked the free space amount on the disk where your files should be saved? Ivana
Comment 2: I don't know where the files get saved. Can you help me.
Comment 3: It's hard to say anything without more info. I suppose your Moodle is not installed and hosted on your own computer? Would it be possible to ask your Moodle administrator, he could check that for you - he needs to login to the server where Moodle is. If you are "just" a regular user, without access to the server where Moodle is, you will not be able to check it yourself anyway.
Comment 4: Thanks a lot.
Comment 5: I know this dredges up an old post but I had this error and thought I should post the solution I figured out.  In my case the issue was that PHP was having problems writing a file to the temp directory and "Failed to write file to disk Error" was the result.  This happend only for files larger than 1MB, even though all max upload file sizes were set to 100MB.  My solution was to edit the php.ini file and make sure to set the upload_tmp_dir setting, make sure that folder existed and that write permissions were enabled.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Powerpoints being downloaded instead of launched
Post description: We have many Powerpoint files being loaded on our Moodle LMS as 'job aids.' When someone clicks on a topic, instead of the Powerpoint file being opened on the screen, the user is forced to download the file. This happens regardless of whether Resource: Link to file or Activities : Add single file file is used. Also, the 'forced download' box in the course settings is not on--so that shouldn't be causing the problem. We don't want our students to have to be forced to download these files every time they want to view them. Does anyone know how to get the PowerPoints to launch when the user clicks on them?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You would need to display them in a different way-for example embedded into slideshare, or, if you prefer to host them on your own Moodle , use Ispring free - they use it at my school -it converts powerpoint to flash so there is no need for downloading - and it keeps the animations.
Comment 2: I have many faculty who I help to put PowerPoint online. This is what I suggest that they do. Upload their powerpoint to google docs, make it an object and then embed the object in any html editor in Moodle. This means less strain on the school server , since the pp is "living" on google docs. here is a video showing the process
Comment 3: Thanks. These are some great ideas. I might try the slide-share method. Unfortunately, I can't use any 3rd party sites to generated these, as some of the training for our engineers may occasionally contain proprietary information (and this training is delivered on an internal LMS for that reason).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Program resources
Post description: I know of two cases of external programs being used as "program" resources: webwork and brainstorm. Are there any more? The original code for this was contributed, and I never had much time to look at it. I was just documenting it though, and I feel like I want to clean it up somewhat, including changing some variable names. This would break any current use of the program resource, but will hopefully make it easier to use in future applications. My proposed list of the information to be sent to external applications is: moodle_navigation: current crumb trail as a serialized, encoded array moodle_resource: the resource id moodle_username: current username
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Could you please include the "ID Number" in the variables to be passed? For courses where the instructor is tracking students by their student IDs, this would be invaluable. For example, I might want to have the outside resource write performance data to a separate (non-Moodle) database .
Comment 2: Absolutely, yes. Good idea.
Comment 3: Are you considering to mkae Moodle "aware" of the activities in these "program resources"? For example if it is a single-student-activity-module, it would be nice if some sort of information exchange about the activity could take place. (The SCORM subset of the old AICC-standard...) If I create a kind of resource with a built-in test, I would like to communicateback to Moodle that student with id=x did the test at time=y and got the score=z.. Moodle should show these results in the Moodle student overview. (I am NOT asking for a complete CBT-structure: there are programs enough that can handle that, but their is no time and money enough in normal education institutes to develop complete tuned CBTs..) With Moodle you arrange activities in a more loose way, so should be the student-result-overview ..
Comment 4: Yes, this is the bidirectionality I mentioned briefly. Mostly it would be returning grades.
Comment 5: Hi Martin, Actually we had to hack the program resource code in v. 1.0.8.1 a bit to get it to work with WeBWorK. We're now rewriting the interface as a separate module, instead of interfacing with the program resource code. So I guess it really doesn't matter for us how you rewrite this code. However just a few comments on your proposed list of information to be passed to an external program.  In my interface with WeBWorK, it is much more convenient to use a single password to the interface, instead of distinct passwords for every URL which accesses the interface, as you are proposing. I don't want to have course creators to have to enter this password every time they create such a URL.  Indeed for the sake of security, I don't want them to know this password. I think you should allow this alternative means of setting up a password. Also I pass the current time (at which the URL was invoked) and hash it with the other information, to guard against replay attacks into WeBWorK. Zig
Comment 6: Yes, good idea about the password. It should at least be an option.
Comment 7: Hi, Zig! It's a year later, but we're actually re-implementing the Program resource module right now, it will make it easy to insert nearly any field from the user, course and config tables, plus a few other things. In addition you can pass these to any Moodle file as well outside URLs. I'm interested in making this as secure as possible, though. What else can we add? You mentioned hashing the time with other information to guard against replay attacks ... can you please explain this in more detail? How does it help? If anyone else has any good ideas for encrypted methods for making a program link more secure, please come forth!
Comment 8: Hi Martin, If someone were eavesdropping on the http exchange when a program resource is being invoked, the eavesdropper could save that information and resend it at some later time from his/her own computer.  If this information didn't have same way of having its validity expired, the eavesdropper would have perpetual login access to the program resource. In my webwork module, the http exchange includes the time of invocation sent in the clear and also hashed with the other login information.  On the other end, the WeBWorK server looks at the time of invocation (sent in the clear) and if it is over 40 seconds old, rejects it.  If not, it hashes the time of invocation into the other secure login information and compares the resulting hash with the one which was sent over by Moodle. Only then  is the login to WeBWorK granted. The relevant code on the Moodle end of the webwork module is 
```text
               if ($webwork->type == GATEWAY) {


		 $temp .= urlencode(md5("My top secret" .$temptime. urlencode($USER->username) . $webwork->quiz_time));


		    } else {


		 $temp .= urlencode(md5("My top secret" .$temptime. urlencode($USER->username)));


		   }
```
 in http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/moodle/contrib/webwork/moodle/mod/webwork/view.php?rev=1.2&view=auto (The GATEWAY version (for a WeBWorK quiz) also has the amount of time allowed for the quiz added to the hash.) The corresponding code on WeBWorK end of the webwork module is my $digest0 = "My top secret"; [deletia] my $moodle_user = $q->param("extern_usr"); my $moodle_name = $q->param("extern_nam"); my $moodle_time = $q->param("extern_tim"); my $moodle_md5 = $q->param("extern_pwd"); my $time = time(); my $digest =  md5_hex($digest0 . $moodle_time . $moodle_user); in http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/moodle/contrib/webwork/webwork/system/cgi/cgi-scripts/moodle2wwk.pl?rev=1.2&view=auto (for homework assignments) and similar code in http://cvs.sourceforge.net/viewcvs.py/moodle/contrib/webwork/webwork/system/cgi/cgi-scripts/moodle2gway.pl?rev=1.2&view=auto (for quizes). As an additional security measure, it would also be worthwhile to allow the client IP address to be part of the information to be hashed. Hope this helps, Zig
Comment 9: Thanks, Zig, very helpful! I like the idea of using the client IP in particular, since that's something that can be easily determined at both ends without sending any data like the time over in the clear. So, for a simplified system, how about if the standard secret key is an md5 hash of: a phrase set by the admin for the whole site ($CFG->resource_secretphrase) and the IP of the current user? That should be enough, yes?
Comment 10: I think the username should also be part of the hash.  Otherwise, I think it should  work great.
Comment 11: The problem is that the username is no longer always sent  (and even when it is, then presumably anyone intercepting the request would then also have this information).
Comment 12: Hi Martin! When you refer to Client IP , does that mean a user could only utilize the programs from specific computers?? WP1
Comment 13: No, it's just one way to confirm that the person arriving at the resource is the same person who clicked on the link within Moodle.
Comment 14: Just a proposal add   moodle_lang: Prefered natural language for the user. -- Sven.-Erik Tiberg --
Comment 15: Hi Would like to suggest moodle_userCat ; User category [ teatcher | student | guest |... ] Are there any need of variables to handle sessions data? -- Sven Tiberg --
Comment 16: Hi Pls. skip my last idea about a session parrameter. Like more to have a cookie paramneter.as session data only resides in one server , couldn't be used by external resoures as they are runniing on other servers. On the other hand cookies are stored in the clients computer and can be used by any resource on any server. moodle_cookieID [ name of cookie consist of "moodle" + a timestamp ] Our purpouse are to transfere information from one resource into the next, where the resources could be running on different server. Example: a laboration to design a drivetrain in a car. more precicly the ratio of gears where you have to itterate the gear ratio layout over acceleration v.s.fueleconomy. This example can consists of a input page for gear ratio and two calculation modules, where the modules would use a common "area" (=cookie) of an array with gear ratios, a URLpointer to specific fuel consumption def. file, a URLpointer to vehicle parramters as CW, frontarea, weight, drive train masses a.s.o. and a URLpointer to a writeable history file. And maybee some more items. Just a 0.50SKr suggestion. Sven-Erik Tiberg
Comment 17: I am a bit confused... I would like to integrate various web applications in Moodle courses. This should give you an idea of the type of applications: an equation plotter (see also this discussion ) multiple regression time series analysis lots of descriptive statistics apps The idea is to have students do assignments with the online applications, based on datasets in a database (maintained by the web application). I would like to be able to do the following: record student analysis activity inside Moodle (the web applications should return information of the type of instruction, and the data that was used) allow students to upload data to the web application's database (Moodle should record the upload in the student's stats - the actual data is stored and maintained by the web app) the output of the web application (either html, xls, doc or pdf) should be displayed in a frame (or a pop-up window) - students should have the option to print, or store the output in their personal archive (stored by Moodle - teachers should be able to define the amount of storage space per student). Stored output can always be retrieved, copied, deleted, or transmitted to students/educators without the need to recompute (or reconnect to the web app). Educators can browse through the archives and leave 'comments'. It should be easy to refer to stored output in forums, etc.. What should I do to achieve this? If I am not mistaken the 'Program' interface is part of the Resource module. Wouldn't it be better to have a separate module? Also, it would be nice if we could have some sort of (PHP) wrapper code to make it easier for the web applications developers to make the web software available to students/Moodlers. Is there anything I can do to make this work?
Comment 18: The new "program resources" are working well in development CVS now. The changes are significant, and old-style program resources are not upgraded to the new system, so please redo your old program resources if you had any. The way it works now is as extra parameters on the standard resource type for adding a file (both uploaded files and external URLs).  There is a big list of data to choose from (suggestions for more are welcome!), and you can assign it any parameter name you like. I expect to see this used a lot to pass information to Javascript and Flash files within Moodle, as well as external web sites. Here is a simple example that may give you some idea of what is now possible.
Comment 19: Hi Martin, I just ran across this and got an idea:  You know I have always wanted to be able to give students (instant) feedback/recommendations based on a quiz score.  Would this work to do this?  By passing their score to a "else if" javascript based on a range of scores that would bring up the feedback? Thanks Chardelle
Comment 20: Hi! Does the solution with the javascript "else if" of Chardelle for the individual feedback on scores exist? If somebody has the solution for this, please, please be so kind and give it to me! Thx Thomas
Comment 21: We would love to have the sesisonid passed in. We would love to be able to correlate the tracking we do in our external python app with the sessionid in moodle (we don't need formal session management, just the unique sessionid) We've made a slight mod to our version of the program resource which lets us keep the moodle header on top of our app (breadcrumbs...), to give the user a seemless experience (they don't know they've "left" moodle), they click around, and currently we have 2 seperate tracking databases.

Post description: Unexpectedly I am no longer able to upload files. I always get the following error message: Warning : move_uploaded_file(/opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/osdata/3//sluit.gif ) [ function.move-uploaded-file ]: failed to create stream: Permission denied in /opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/files/index.php on line 118 Warning : move_uploaded_file() [ function.move-uploaded-file ]: Unable to move '/opt/www/vandijckl/web/tmp/phpzgkjcg' to '/opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/osdata/3//sluit.gif' in /opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/files/index.php on line 118 Can this be related to incorrect permission settings on the server ? Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think the problem is somewhere in your config file.. you got an extra / in the end.. 3//sluit.gif In your config you probably ended som path info with / if you remove that it probably will work.
Comment 2: I've checked config.php but there is no slash (/) at the end of any path description. A new attempt to upload a file gave this result: Warning : move_uploaded_file(/opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/osdata/3/exp001/cleest.gif ) [ function.move-uploaded-file ]: failed to create stream: Permission denied in /opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/files/index.php on line 118 Warning : move_uploaded_file() [ function.move-uploaded-file ]: Unable to move '/opt/www/vandijckl/web/tmp/phpzCQ6oU' to '/opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/osdata/3/exp001/cleest.gif' in /opt/www/vandijckl/web/ www.e-klas.net/os/files/index.php on line 118 Notice that the double slash is not present, probably because I selected a subdirectory here.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Resource sharing error.
Post description: I want to share a perticular resource between 2 courses. I add a resource resource to my new course, and specify the resource type as a web page. Following which on in the URL field I specify the URL from the course which has already has a resource as an uploaded file. On doing this I get the following error: Warning : urldecode() expects parameter 1 to be string, object given in /home/chauhana/public_html/dev/moodle/mod/resource/index.php on line 66 Can somebody help.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You can't upload a file to course A and then use it in course B, because the files uploaded to course A are only accessible to users of that course. If you are the admin of your site, though, you can upload the file to the site's "Files" and then make it available in both courses, A and B.
Comment 2: I'm having the same trouble. I have logged in as the site admin and uploaded some files to "Site Files". Course A and course B both need to access these files. But, course A and course B can't access "Site Files" via a "Directory Resource" or any other method I've tried. Can you explain how to: " ...upload the  files to the site's "Files" and then make it available in both courses, A and B " I'm using 1.3.1
Comment 3: On this matter, has anyone figured a simple, friendly way to allow tutors to choose nln materials to add to their course from a central repository or do they have to actually upload the same resource to numerous courses. We are currently using webct and are at a stage where we are thinking (and hoping) to move to moodle, but this seems to be a feature that is missing on moodle that is available in webct and other vles. Even if the nln materials were added to the "site files" it appears that the tutor can not then add a "resource" from the site files.....or am I wrong here? I would love to move to moodle but I am stumbling at the thought of many (many!) tutors having to download nln materials from somewhere outside of moodle and then upload them to their course area.  I was hoping they would be able import directly from a central repository of materials via the "add resource" feature......or am I way off the mark here? I just want a simple (techno-newbie) way of viewing a list of nln materials and then choosing to import some into a course, even if it has to be one by one.  This seems to be the only big niggle for me at the moment. Many thanks in anticipation of your help. Julia
Comment 4: I am also a new user, working to implement Moodle for a large FE college in North Lincolnshire (North Lindsey College). We have found the add-on NLN module, which solves the specific problem Julia had with nln materials. BUT.... what about other files that we would like all tutors to be able to access and add to their courses. We have a large collection of video clips that I was hoping to make available centrally in some form of repository - the aim being that tutors could then access this repository when adding resources to their own courses. Does anybody know how this can be achieved? Thanks - Pete
Comment 5: Hi Pete, One solution would be to use a package called RELOAD , which enables you to bundle materials together in a form which is then readable by the Object module. RELOAD has been discussed elsewhere on these forums, so if you do a search you should find something about it. Regards Chris
Comment 6: Hi Chris, Thanks for your help. I downloaded RELOAD a couple of weeks ago and have been meaning to look at it as an object authoring tool... but I didn't think of it as a solution for my shared videos problem. I'll get it installed and check it out! Many thanks - Pete
Comment 7: Hi Julia, Yes, you want the Object module, which is downloadable from the Moodle site.  It allows one repository to not only serve several courses, but several Moodle installations on the same server (we're currently operating eleven!) Regards Chris
Comment 8: Just wondering if this question was ever answered? I too have been unable to find how to share files between courses, and have not found an answer as yet on the forums. Thanks

Post title: 1.9.4 Resource linking to html file no longer working
Post description: Hello: I publish Moodle content using Moodle 1.9.4, I receive from the instructors.  I do not have access to the Moodle source code or the server which it rests on, it is in another time zone.  I have published all our courses for the summer by using absolute URLs in iframes.  I have made it so I can update the files in one course and all the other courses get updated.  It works great!  So, all resources have the same iframe code to a specific course id.  The students just have to enrollment themselves in the “Master” course and then they view all the resources from the course in their main course. However, I am nervous about the number of students we are going to have and so I want to create a course that has all the files stored locally.  In the past, our first trial with Moodle before I started, everything was on .htm pages and was linked through the resource “Link to file or webpage.”  All the html was appearing without issues, links to other html files in the same classroom were working and pictures were appearing.  Now, if I link to the document that html file is broken.  All pictures only show the alt text and all internal links are broken.  Even past courses, which I have never touched, are breaking.  I wish I could provide you with when it happened.  I would guess sometime around the use of iframes. I use Dreamweaver to make the html file the way I like than I either copy it into the HTML editor or zip the files and unzip them in Moodle.  Any file in the course files section that I “link to” will not work, including composing a webpage and pasting the code.  It seems to only want to use absolute links now.   However the iframe(d) code works fine. If the server holds and there is no problem with the number of users (about 1,200 students, 30 instructors, at any point about 670 students could be attempting to load the same resource at one time) this issue is not important.  I do not know the type of server or OS running.  I have asked repeatedly but I have not received an answer.  However I also am in charge of the backup plan and I would like to have one ready to go when the course starts so that the students always have a class ready to go. I have read threads about the HTML editor breaking because of bad code, the max number of users in Moodle http://docs.moodle.org/20/en/User_site_capacities , and other trackers about html issues http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-10769 . I would like to know if using iframes has messed up my linking to courses or if I have done something incorrectly when creating my classes.  I do have access to the administrator login to Moodle but I cannot see any code.    If anyone has any suggestions on why this is happening so suddenly, please let me know what I need to do to fix it.  Thank you so much in advance!

Post title: How to add video that can both stream and download?
Post description: Hi Moodlers, We post .wmv files for students as a maor component of their course.  I have been posting these to display 'in pop-up'.  Previously I thought they were able to also, with IE , right click and save as to save the target file.  Now with 2.3.2 the browser only wants to save a view.php file, not the target. They can easily be embedded in resources, played natively in browsers (without additional flash players) and downloadable at the same time. The coverter I use for video is Miro Video converter (Win, Mac and Linux): http://www.mirovideoconverter.com Cheers Stan
Comment 2: Stan, Thank you for the suggestion. I found that the php handler doesn't stream well, and eventually just post to YouTube and embedd.  They play much better. I zip and post the video files for download as a separate item. Not a perfect solution, but seems to work to the students satisfaction.

Forum Post: 
Post title: How can I move multiple files from one topic/week to another?
Post description: Is there a way to do this? moving them one by one is quite cumbersome. Any insight is greatly appreciated!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I just stumbled upon the same problem, and even if the question is old and probably you found another solution or gave up, here is a way that I found to do it: 1) create a new topic / week, 2) move the new topic/week close to the topic/week where you have the objects you want to block-move, 3) move the objects to the new created topic, here you have to do it one by one, but since the topics are contiguous it is not so much work, especially if you have " ajax " enabled, 4) move the new created topic with the objects you already moved close the topic week were you want to put them, 5) proceed manually again to move them there. Of course this solution works best with "ajax" enabled, moving them with the arrows is a pain.
Comment 2: Me too. This looks interesting, I'm installing it now and will report back here if it works. https://moodle.org/plugins/view.php?plugin=block_massaction
Comment 3: Highly recommend the mass action plugin. Had it for a year or so and it been a huge time saver
Comment 4: howz this work for you in Moodle 2.x where AJAX is no longer tied to the user?
Comment 5: Just to confirm, the mass actions block has prooved very useful. One on my teachers said it's the best thing to happen to Moodle for years.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Updating a pdf file in Moodle
Post description: I am a new Moodle user organizing by Topics.  The Resources I have added to most Topics are folders each of which contains a set of PDF files.  For example, in the Chapter 4 Topic, I have a folder called Notes containing files named Section_4.1.pdf, Section_4.2.pdf, etc.  I made some changes to my original Word file for Section 4.1, saved the changes to my computer in pdf format, and tried to upload to Moodle still naming the revised file Section_4.1.pdf.  However, Moodle reverts to the original Section_4.1.pdf. How can I update a pdf file and still use the old Moodle name? Thank you for any help you can offer. Dotty  Delaware County Community College
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, I have seen this behaviour some times. In every case, it was due to caching, either brwoser caching proxy or server caching.  You are seeing the old page stored in memory (or disk), not the new one. This occurs if both files are named the same. If you "refresh" (or "reload", or press F3, the name varies among browsers) the page in the browser then the brwoser will be forced to actually reload again the data, and you will see the correct file. - Enrique -
Comment 2: Hi, Enrique, Your suggestion worked perfectly.  Thank you for taking the time to help me. Dotty

Forum Post: 
Post title: Import text format problem.
Post description: I recently developed a method of converting courses to Moodle 1.8 from Blackboard 6.3. A problem that i'm having, is that the summary is generated from the first 100 characters of the resource body. This means that if the resource body had some content that starts out like this: "Here is some content. I hope that someone can help me solve this problem because I am having some difficulty with it. Moodle Forums are very active and helpful." Then the summary would look like this: "Here if some content. I hope that someone can help me solve this problem because I am having some diff" You can see that the most undesirable thing is that the summaries end up being chopped off in the middle of words/sentences. I thought of a few possible solutions: 1: Delete the summary from the resources page or force it to be blank. 2: Extend the length of the summary from 100 chars to something larger. 3: Make the summary by reading until the first end of sentence character (period, exclamation, or question mark).

Forum Post: 
Post title: Uploaded resource frame vanishes when upgrading from 1.3x to 1.4x
Post description: I've just tried upgrading my test installation from moodle 1.3.4 to 1.4.2 and have discovered a major problem. All of the courses on my server use uploaded files for the content, but while upgrading to 1.4.2, I have discovered that the navigation bar is no longer displayed by when viewing such resources. This seems to be due to a new feature allowing the user to specify whether or not the nav bar is visible for individual resource, unfortuantly the default for this feature changes the previous behavour of moodle, which showed the nav bar above uploaded pages. The new feature is good and potentially useful, but it really should preserve the previous behaviour as the default. There is no way I can roll out 1.4.2 onto our main server, since this would break every single course on our server and require every single page resource in every course to be edited to get back the nav bar. There are 1000's of such resources and this would take weeks to do ! Is there any way of globally re-enabling the nav bar for uploaded resource without having to spend weeks editing every single resource ? I've looked and can't find any options.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I'm assuming since nobody has replied that there is no solution to this problem. So i'll treat it as bug and report it in the relevant place.

Post title: IMS Content Package annoyances
Post description: When creating a IMSCP resource I encountered the following problems: Creating the Moodle resource worked fine; however, when you re-open the settings form, the file name of the IMS CP module is no longer visible. When you are playing the IMSCP module, it always shows a Table of Contents that cannot be surpressed. AFAIK the table of contents is derived from the "organisations" element in the IMS CP manifest. AFAIK it is allowed to have zero organisation elements. Therefore, to get rid of the table of contents when playing the module, I removed the organisation element. The result is that Moodle does not play the IMS CP module at all due to a file error. Best regards

Forum Post: 
Post title: Updating File in Resource
Post description: I am using 1.8 and having problems updating a file being referenced in the resource module. Because you evidently can not edit referenced files directly within Moodle I have a Word document that I have updated and saved to my local folder. I went clicked on the Update icon next to the reference taking me to Edit Resource and clicked on the Choose or Upload a file button. There, I selected and deleted the file I want to update (which asked me if I wanted to delete the file completely and I answered yes). Returning to the Choose or Upload a File location, I then uploaded the new updated Word file. I then went to the Link to a File or Web site location, deleted the file, then clicked Save Changes. I then returned to Edit Resource location, selected the new updated file (it having the more recent date/time stamp). It opens the file up but I STILL HAVE THE OLD VERSION!!! What am I doing wrong? This seems very convoluted to make simple changes to a referenced file!! Thank You
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Dale, I'd recommend a couple of things you might want to try out. 1. Clear your cache file, or better yet, try to access the file on a different computer.  It might be that your browser is actually not trying to download the file. 2. When I change, I usually do this through FTP .  This way, I don't have to worry anything about the links themselves within moodle. Hope this helps!
Comment 2: Are you giving the new file the same name as the older version? It will work if you give it a different name. It is a cache issue, yes, but for speed of success I usually just rename an updated file.

Forum Post: 
Post title: set of .html files as resource
Post description: Hello, I would like to know if I can configure inside moodle a set of .htmls files so it would be traceable (each individual .html file). I mean, suppose I have 1.html, 2.html and 3.html. And suppose I have a link inside 1.html that points to 2.html file. And a link inside 2.html file tha points to 3.html file. Making 1.html the main file, if I navigate (using the links) to 2.html and 3.html, the student log would show me only the 1.html visited. But I want that it tracks and show on reports also 2.html and 3.html access? The book module seems to allow me create .html files traceable but it has the drawbacks I cannot use any . css , or .js. In the book module I am restricted to .html that is wrapped by moodle. The solution it seems possible so far is to use a SCORM package. But it seems SCORM is not very flexible in termos of HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript . I can also create each .html file as a resource. But it could be very tiring to set an entire course full of hundreds of .html pages. Anyone that had the same requirements and could share a solution?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You CAN use CSS within the Book module. Depending on what/how much you want to target, you could use... 
```text
#page-mod-book-view {}
```
 or 
```text
.box.generalbox.book_content {}
```
 You can even target individual books, eg. 
```text
.cmid-78 {}
```
 You also reference external css and js using the 'Additional HTML’ settings in Site Admin > Appearance. Alternatively, you can upload multiple html files to the File activity. Mark your first page as the 'Set Main Page', and it will behave like a mini website within Moodle. See https://docs.moodle.org/30/en/File_resource_settings#Displaying_a_website_index_page for more info.
Comment 2: Thanks for the answer. We are trying to create a "mini website" as you called. It seems the book option will not work since we want do use css and js so as to create rich interfaces (something like: circular menus, accordions, lightboxes, image galleries, drag and drop interaction and animations). I will study the "Additional HTML" settings you mentioned. The File activity as you pointed is at the moment our best choise but it has a drawback that it does not track the pages individually so we could see which pages the student has visited. For instance: Making 1.html the main file, if I navigate (using the links) to 2.html and 3.html, the student log would show me only the 1.html visited. But I want that it tracks and show on reports also 2.html and 3.html access? Maybe I am doing something wrong. Thanks in advance.
Comment 3: Hi Márcio, I think you might be able to do what you want to do by using the Lesson activity with content or question pages as your html page. I do know that when a user visits/naswers a question page, it appears in the logs. Another possibility is to use a combination of page resources with various Generico filters for the menus, accordions, lightboxes, image galleries, etc. Of course, all the Generico stuff can be used in the Lesson activity, as well as in the Book resource.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moving files out of a repository
Post description: Hi everyone, I am about to migrate my moodle from 1.9.16 to 2.3.3 but there is still something that's keeping me from migrating. Up until now, once a year I move all course files (lessons, assignments, foro attachments and so on)  from my web server to a backup copy. I need to do that because I have to pay for any extra disc I use.  Besides, I want to keep the courses structure so I can keep students enrolments, grades, etc...which is quite necessary for my organization. That's why I can not delete old courses. My question is, how can I move all those files out of the repository in one go without deleting a course? Is there any moodle function that I can use? Thanks in advance.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The file structure for Moodle 2 is very different from 1.9, so it may not be possible to do what you want -- but I'm no expert. With luck, someone will be able to tell you how to do this in Moodle 2. However, what you could do is set up your own Moodle server on your personal/office computer, then backup the Moodle courses online and restore them to your local host system. Then you can delete them from the pay-for server while still having access to the marks etc when you need them. This may be using a sledge-hammer or wrecking ball to crack a nut, but the nut will be cracked. Anne

Forum Post: 
Post title: can't modify an uploaded file
Post description: I have a  course set up and want to make some changes. It says in the help area to just upload the file with the same name and it will automatically be overwritten. This doesn't seem to be the case however. I have uploaded the file by the same name but the old version still appears. I have deleted the file and uploaded again and still the old version appears. I have used refresh to refresh the page. To no avail. What is the problem? Thanks for any help Jacira
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: The old document is still cached somewhere (not necessarily in your own browser, could be anywhere between your server and your browser). The document has a lifetime of 24 hours by default but you can change that by setting $CFG->filelifetime to the number of seconds somewhere in your config.php file. The only way to make sure that the new file is available immediately is to give it a different name.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add New Mimetype in 2.6
Post description: I'm trying to add a mimetype for mobi files, so I can display a proper icon in my courses, but I can't get the new icon to display. I've added a couple of lines to filelib.php: 'mobi' => array ('type'=>'application/x-mobipocket-ebook', 'icon'=>'mobi'), 'mobi' => array ('type'=>'AZW/Mobi', 'icon'=>'mobi'), (For the record, I added the second after the first didn't work, just to see...) I've added the appropriate icons to my theme's pix_core/f/ folder, where there are other icons currently overriding the defaults. I also used "Purge all caches" from the Administration > Development menu, to see if that would help. Just for kicks, I added the mimetype to my server 's .htaccess: AddType application/x-mobipocket-ebook .mobi Nothing seems to work. The problem seems to be that Moodle isn't recognizing the mimetype. In the HTML, the icon reads as: component=core&image=f%2Funknown-24 Can anyone spot what I'm doing wrong? Still the wrong mimetype name, maybe?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think I've got it—here's what I learned, for future reference: (1) I probably should have tried this earlier, but clicking the "display file details" button in the uploader show the mimetype of the files you're uploading. In this case, it turns out I needed AZW/mobi. Huh. (2) Out of desperation, I threw my same mobi.png files into the core pix/f/ folder, and the mobi icons all of a sudden appeared as expected. That didn't make sense, since my epub icons in my theme's pix_core/f/ folder were overriding the original epub icons. And then it did make sense—I'm guessing that my mobi icons in my theme's folder weren't overriding Moodle's default icon because there was no default icon to override in the first place. When I added a mobi icon to the core, everything clicked into place. Main lesson ? When adding a completely new mimetype, add the icons to the core instead of the theme. (I suppose.)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Uploading folders to the resource area
Post description: Excuse my ignorance - I'm what is known as a "jobbing moodler"  ie I am learning, sometimes painfully, as I go along! How do I upload a folder into the resource area?  I can upload any number of files, but folders are a mystery to me! Thank you.  Linda
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Don't worry - I've worked it out - you use "directory"!
Comment 2: can you explain this a bit more? I have hundreds of files in several folders i need to upload, it would be handy if i could just upload the folders but i've no idea how to.....
Comment 3: Hi Trish, Go to the module you wish to insert your folders into Click on "add a resource" Click on "display a directory" Insert what you want to call your folder Click on "save changes" You will then be offered all the resources showing in the module you wish to insert your folder into. Select the resources and follow remaining instructions Obviously, you will need to have saved all the contents of your folders as resources in the appropriate module before you can select them to put into your new folder (there is probably a much easier and faster way to do it than this, but I only had one or two folders to create so didn't need to find a faster/shorter route) Best of luck Trish Linda
Comment 4: Hi there. You need to get your folder on your computer's hard drive and right click it - choose send to>compressed/zipped folder. You will get the same folder again but with a zip on. Then go to your course page on Moodle,click on files in the admin block and upload your zipped folder in the same way as you would upload a single resource. Then when you have got the folder (ending in .zip) into your course files, click to unzip it - it will list all the contents and you click OK to accept it. You'll then get the folder again, unzipped and you can either display each individual resource separately or you can do as suggested and use the 'display a directory' option in Add a Resource to show the whole folder on the page. Students then just click on the folder and can access the resources themselves. This makes the page a bit neater.
Comment 5: thank you very much for this. That's given me a very quick and easy way to cope with what was threatening to be a very difficult problem!
Comment 6: Hi Trish, just one thing I'd recommend taking into consideration... if you manually place the folder into the module and then use the display directory function, make sure the file names have no spaces, since if they do you (nor students) will not be able to download any files.  If you use the .zip option you don't have to worry, since moodle will create the files replacing the spaces with underscores.

In order to let non-administrative users edit certain Moodle pages but not others might be possible, but someone who does have the administrative password plus extensive knowledge of the underlying mysql database would be required (to set it up), I think. In other words I'm not sure if it is possible. But it still might not be a good idea, even if possible. You do need to be careful. I've been working on content management systems for web pages in the general context for a long time. I have two CMS systems I've written that both allow
Comment 3: What about if you use the wiki, with Type set to Student?
Comment 4: Wiki would be good too, except that it's more difficult for students to add images than it is for teachers to add images. You'd have to show them how first.
Comment 5: Thanks for everyones' comments. I'm probably letting the teacher of this class run the show here more than I should and I'm just trying to come up with a solution that might be best done another way. The request from the teacher is a way to setup editable regions on the class Moodle site so that each student can be responsible for creating a study guide for a chapter complete with picture, links, etc. The teacher wants next years class to be able to view these as well. Last year he used a forum for his AP class to do something similar with each student submitting ideas and questions, but now I'm stuck with having to separate that content from the user/profiles. I believe if I were to reset the course I would have to be careful not reset that forum in fear of loosing that data. Also, we couldn't use pictures within the forum unless they were part of a word doc that was attached....which is no good. I've thought about a wiki and that might be the best solution. Thoughts? Post title: Control size of NEW resource window when lauched...
Post description: Unfortunately, I am using moodle version 1.5.2, so that may have a bearing on the answer (if there is one). When a user clicks on a resource link, I have set the resource to launch in a New Window and, according to the instructions, left the fields blank. I had set the windows to open 800x600 but that was cumbersome. Leaving the size fields blank is supposed to open the new window the same size as the window it was launched from. If you leave these fields blank then the new popup window will be exactly the same size as the window they clicked on to get the popup. When I set the size to 800x600, the new window always launched as an 800x600 window. However, when the I leave the fields blank, the following happens: If the browser is IE , then the new window opens to the correct width(!) but the height is very, very small... Post title: Adding many web pages
Post description: I have uploaded a zip file with several web pages to be added to a topic. It seems I have to add each one individually, giving each a name, picking the type, and typing in a summary.  This is rather tedious.  Is there a way that I can add all the web pages in one go (like I can in WebCT)? Also, can Moodle be made to extract the page name from the html title tag (again like WebCT). Thank you Geoff Dische
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Path of least resistance: you could unzip them in moodle to a new directory, then create a directory resource pointing to your new directory of web pages If they are supposed to be studied as a sequence: copy and paste the content into pages in a lesson , then you'll probably want to use the facilities to add quiz questions or Package them as a scorm package outside moodle, and install the scorm module, which just gets more and more reliable; I use reload ( www.reloa d.ac.uk ) and I know that uses the title tag but I don't think that the moodle module does Hope this is useful, Andy D
Comment 2: You could create an e-book out of your pages and upload them as one file that way. This software works well for me -- http://natata.hn3.net/ebook_products.html -- Art
Comment 3: Hi! I am working on some similar functionality in Book module just now...
Comment 4: You can do this fairly easily. Create a zip file with all of your web pages and necessary image files. Its best if these are designed for a flat structure, and all of your links are relative. Upload the zip file to a directory in your course file structure - use the 'files' functions. Unzip the file using the 'files' function. Then, just add a file resource pointing to the starting page of your uploaded web pages. Works like a charm. mike
Comment 5: Fab answer...this has helped me enormously - trying to uploading from zone where firewalls restrict access has been a problem for me on occassion. Now it's not. Well done that man!
Comment 6: I tried this and none of the links worked - it seems to want to map to the root of the moodle tree rather than the current directory. Any ideas? This would be very handy if I could get it to work.
Comment 7: Thank you all for your suggestions.  I've got lots of ideas to try now! Geoff

Forum Post: 
Post title: Question Marks replacing some characters in htm files
Post description: Good day, We have been experiencing problems with htm files in our migration process from another LMS to Moodle (applies only to htm files produced in Microsoft Word or PowerPoint).  Question marks are appearing instead of long dashes,  single quotes (magic quotes I believe they're called), and repeated spaces. In all the posts I've read, the question mark issue comes up for non-English characters when the default Character Set is not set to UTF-8.  I'm wondering if this is our problem as well. Our install is Moodle 1.5.3: Fedora Core 2 MySQL 3.23.58 PHP 4.3.4 mbstring enabled (OK status for all these in Moodle Environment page). In order to test if this is a UTF-8 related issue, I then installed Moodle 1.6.3 on a different machine (running CentOS 4.3). I uploaded a couple of the htm files, and the same problem occurs.  Note though, this second Moodle instance  is not yet UTF-8, since the Environment page mbstring status says Check.  The Environment page also says that the My SQL version installed needs to be upgraded in order to guarantee that all data will be converted to UTF-8 in the future. I'm still new to linux, and have been unsuccessful thus far in upgrading MySql or installing/enabling mbstring (GD also has to be installed/enabled). My question is, with respect to the question marks, can anyone say for sure that this is definitely (or definitely not) a UTF-8 related issue? We have quite alot of these htm files to clean up (a number of work-arounds have been discovered, but they involve processing each htm file, one at a time).  Our hope is that there is some setting to change which will allow all such files to display correctly. Thanks, Lindsay.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Good day, The problem has been resolved.  The solution actually, required a change in the settings away from UTF-8 in apache (commenting out the default character set which was set to UTF-8, and commenting out some of the mbstring settings). The Microsoft produced htm files now display correctly! Hope this helps anyone else who experienced this problem.
Comment 2: ...required a change in the settings ... Could you be more specific, please? if data in my MySql tables are stored as UTF-8, which charset has apache to use as default instead of UTF-8? Will I need to modify the way (php sources) the Moodle fetch those data too? which mbstring setting did you comment out? Thanks in advace

Forum Post: 
Post title: powerpoint
Post description: I couldnt' find an appropriate forum to post this thread so I am putting it on here. Does anyone know if I could put a powerpoint presentation on Moodle as a resource link?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Yes, by all means. Upload in the usual way; choose 'add a resource' and select your powerpoint. However - it might also be worth putting a link to Powerpoint viewer in case your students don't have Powerpoint installed at home. Or else point them in the direction of Open Office Impress which will read Powerpoint.
Comment 2: There is a discussion of this in the docs, btw . One concern for me has always been the question of client apps, and for me the fewer and more open the client apps the better all are. That being said, I think you are well served by converting the ppt file to flash or converting the ppt to web. In the former case you can simply upload and link to one file (and you are requiring that all have access to a flash viewer) and in the latter you would need to zip up all the files produced and upload them to an appropriate directory and unzip, linking to the contents html doc from you resource page, in which case you need no additional clients. Of course you could always look at using something like S5 . Critical issues for me have been: Whether the format deployed can be opened with an open client (ppt can not) Whether the format deployed has helper apps on all platforms (again, nix on ppt) Whether the format deployed is easily managed (ppt ranks a so-so in my book) Having supported students using OS X, MS-Windows and a variety of linux flavors, my choice has been S5 or html first, followed by flash.
Comment 3: I think a search of Moodle Docs would be helpful: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Special:Search?search=powerpoint&go=Go
Comment 4: Just going to move this discussion to the resource module forum, so people can find it easily in future.
Comment 5: Hi Marcy, I did a little tutorial on using Google Presentations (free, online powerpoint like system that imports Powerpoint, converts it to HTML/ AJAX , and allows you to publish it on the web) to put a PowerPoint into Moodle:
Comment 6: I am so glad that you have started a blog , Michael. For me, it will has already become a "must-read." I look forward to whatever bits of wisdom I can glean from future posts. -- Art
Comment 7: Hi Marcy, Here is a step-by-step tutorial of convert PowerPoint presentations to Flash file with animations and transitions and then upload to Moodle. As you know, with Flash format, your students do not need to use the PowerPoint viewer to view it. Just use the IE browser to open it. No need to care about the compatibility of Windows and Mac. Hope it helps! Claire

Forum Post: 
Post title: Spreadsheet macros vs. security issues - how to get macros working?
Post description: Teaching accounting goes well with spreadsheets with macros. I trying to upload these MSExcel-files into Moodle. Only the macros do not function. Problem seems to lie in the security levels of Moodle. This cannot be altered, says the administration. Is there a by-way or am I posing a wrong question? I have tried to solve the problem with converting the spreadsheets in VisualBasic -.exe -files, but that does not make the administrator extremely happy? Please give a hand! Yours truly Juha-Pekka Rautanen
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have uploaded Excel files and when they are downloaded the macros work fine. The security warnings I get are related to Microsoft Excel's security settings and nothing to do with Moodle. Moodle settings, I think, can prevent you uploading certain types of file but this doesn't sound like your problem. VBA can do some pretty nasty stuff and many network admins will not allow the security settings to be changed to allow it with good reason. We set the security to high and users have to make a deliberate decision to lower it using the tools - macro - security menu (set it to medium, save the file, close it and reopen it to allow macros to be used) Are you downloading the file, Saving and then opening through Excel. Or just opening which opens it in a web browser and gives you less access to the Excel interface?
Comment 2: Hi, Was there ever any follow-up on this issue? I am new to Moodle and am working in a support role in a third-level college. This morning I received a query from a member of academic staff. He has uploaded an Excel file to his course page. This Excel file contains macros. When students open the file, and have chosen to enable macros, they are asked to type in their student ID number. If they number they type in is incorrect, they receive an error message, but the file reopens and the students are again prompted to enable macros. If they enable macros the second time 'round, the worksheet open up. However, if a student attempts to launch any macros in the worksheet, Excel crashes. One workaround is to instruct students to save the Excel file before opening it. In this case, if student type in an incorrect ID number, the worksheet closes and does not reopen. Any ideas would be very welcome! Thanks, M.
Comment 3: That is a MS-problem. The use of excel for such a thing is a bad idea. You (student) must have the same excel version, as the author of the macro.. S.
Comment 4: As there was no reply from the original poster to my reply I guess it helped but cannot be sure. Are you sure that it is a moodle issue? I do not see anything in moodle that gets 'inside' an Excel file, or changes the permissions of Excel. Can you replicate the problem from within college AND somewhere external, if not then it is not a moodle setting that is causing the issue. Has the professor tried some other method of transfer that works (email, file transfer, memory stick)?

Post title: How to Change the Icon for a Custom Resource Type?
Post description: Hi, I am creating a new resource type in Moodle 1.9.9. It seems to me I cannot use a different icon other than the default one. The only way to do this is to modify the function resource_get_coursemodule_info() in mod/resource/lib.php, which I try not to touch the core code. Does anyone know how else I could do this? Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: As far as I can see from the code, you should be able to specify an icon type in the "reference" field for your resource. The function you mentioned will take care of retrieving the correct file. Default icon types are listed in lib/filelib.php in the get_mimetypes_array. If you want a custom icon, you might want to add the icon in f/WHATEVER.gif
Comment 2: Correction. What I stated simply apply to "file" resources. You're perfectly right. You either change that core function or live with the default icon.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Resources within a web page
Post description: Hi People! Moodle V. 1.9 being used here. I'm in the process of developing a course which is broken down into four modules. From the main menu, a student is given an introductory statement to each module. Each module has been created in a 'topic box' which was created when I created the course. Under the introductory statement is a link going to a webpage created within moodle. Inside the webpage is the module course material, made up of course material, external websites, moodle quizes, moodle assignments, moodle resources. At the moment, I've had to create a Fifth topic which I've called "Course Resource Material - Do Not Touch". In this topic I've created the Moodle quizes and assignments that I have linked inside each of the four modules webpages. This looks really ugly and I need to think of a way around it, but can't think of anything! My question is this: Is there anyway I can create the moodle resources (quizes, assignments, resource) straight into my Web page (which has also been created with Moodle)? If not, is there anyway to create them somewhere else (maybe in another course?) and link them back? Or even have them hidden to the student but still accessible through the page? Any ideas would be muchly appreciated!! Thanks, Cory
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Cory, What I used to do in such cases is set the number of topics to display only the relevant topics. So if my resources were in the fifth I set the number of topics to 4. Yes, when I needed to add a resource I had to go to the course settings, set the number of topics to 5, add the resource and then change the settings again. Not very elegant but in courses which had a stable predefined structure this solution worked reasonably well. An alternative way which I started to use recently for a slightly different purpose but should work in this case too is to show the topic block only in editing mode. I add to course sites an html block in the bottom right corner. In this block I insert javascript which detects whether the page is in editing mode, and if it is not, I set the style.display of certain sections on the page to 'none' so that they are not displayed when not in editing mode which means that even I don't see them and bothered by their ugliness when I don't need to make changes in them. Now, you can get the editing mode from the body tag by // detect edit mode var arTmp=document.getElementsByTagName("body"); var theBody=arTmp[0]; var editMode=theBody.className.search(/editing/gi);
Comment 2: Itamar! You're a champ! Your idea of removing the Resource topic works perfectly! I thought that removing the topic would remove all the information contained within that topic - but NO! This works really well for me, as once the course has been fully set up, it will not be touched again (if it is, it will only be minor modification made). So having to show the topic again, is not a real issue. Again, thank you very much for this! Cory
Comment 3: The open universtity have created a new type of resource called a Resource Page. that allows you to do exactly what you are doing without any of the hassle of hidden topics. Unfortunatly "resource page" only works on Moodle installs that are running on the postgres database . I don't think there are any plans for the OU to widen the support of this unit but hopefully someone will make it MySQL compatible. There is a new feature issue on the Moodle Tracker about course sub pages http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-13908 that you can vote on.

Comment 1: If you go to add a resource>folder and upload a zipped folder, then you can unzip it and display its contents - is that what you want to do? Then in future days you can add an individual file to that folder resource and it will show up on the front page.

Comment 3: Yes you can zip files in Legacy course files (though I am not sure what you want to do this for?)
