Forum Post: 
Post title: PowerPoint Slideshow
Post description: Can someone please explain why a PowerPoint 2003 slideshow presentation (.pps), which correctly opens as a slideshow when double clicked on my PC....opens as a PowerPoint document when opened on the same PC, from the Moodle site running on a localhost and logged in as a user? More importantly...how can I fix it! Thanks, Paul
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I can't explain it but I'd strongly advise you to try using a different format when  uploading powerpoint - so that everyone can access them easily without the need for downloading or having Powerpoint viewer etc..  have you tried ispringsolutions (google it !) It is a free program that converts Powerpoints to flash files, retaining animations.
Comment 2: Hi Paul, I've been struggling with the same issue ever since Office 2007 was installed at our college. At one level I do agree with Mary's answer but there are very many people who have uploaded PowerPoint presentations on our Moodle and they still need for them to work the way they expect them to. I have today convinced our network team here to make the following registry change (as advised in a Microsoft technical post): Start Registry Editor Locate and click this key in the registry: HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\PowerPoint.Show.8 Double click on the Data type: REG_DWORD Change the Value data: to 8 Close Registry Editor Try this on your local PC and it should fix the problem. The bigger issue is that you can't control what's happening for all your other users. For us in the college the change will be rolled out to all our users but even then we can't influence our users when they are at home. Sorry this is a bit wordy - I do hope it helps with your immediate problem. P.S. This is not a Moodle problem - you would hit the same problem with the presentations on any server
Comment 3: Thanks Mary and Dave, After posting I had a look around other forums and as you suggested, this is a genital problem, probably related to Internet Explorer.  I have converted them to .html multipage files; surprisingly it seems to work very well. They open with a navigation bar on LHS with slide titles, as with PowerPoint files, but if you click on "Slideshow" in bottom RH of status bar, a full screen slideshow opens in a new window. Thanks again. Paul

Thanks! Sarah Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: I think this works... Edit lib/weblib.php at about line 319 (I'm on v1.4.1, may be a slightly different line number for other versions). It looks like: function link_to_popup_window ($url, $name="popup", $linkname="click here", $height=400, $width=500, $title="Popup window", $options="none", $return=false) { /// This will create a HTML link that will work on both /// Javascript and non-javascript browsers. /// Relies on the Javascript function openpopup in javascript.php /// $url must be relative to home page  eg /mod/survey/stuff.php global $CFG; if ($options == "none") { $options = "menubar=0,location=0,scrollbars,resizable,width=$width,height=$height"; } $fullscreen = 0; $link = " wwwroot $url\" ". "onClick=\"return openpopup('$url', '$name', '$options', $fullscreen);\">$linkname\n"; if ($return) { return $link; } else { you need to change that red highlighted bit to: global $CFG; if ($options == "none") { $options = "menubar= 1 ,location=0,scrollbars,resizable,width=$width,height=$height"; } $fullscreen = 0; if you want a menu bar (which should allow users to select File > Save or File > Print) and change it to global $CFG; if ($options == "none") { $options = "menubar= 1 ,location= 1 ,scrollbars,resizable,width=$width,height=$height"; } $fullscreen = 0; if you want the document's address to be displayed in the location bar. Post title: 2.4.3 Save button would be nice Add'n
Post description: When developing page resources, sometimes, you just need to write, preview, rewrite, ...etc. The current choices at the bottom of the page resource are Save and Return, and Save and Display. There is no button just labelled Save.  Since Save and Display won't run an external macros (like links to MathJax), you can't preview TeX formatted math with that display.  "Save and return" means that you need to return to the main page and in order to return to editing, you must find the small gear icon after scrolling back down to the point in the class that has the assignment. With modern, multi-tab browsers, its time for just a save button.  Then someone in the process of editing and testing would just need to save then then switch to the tab already displaying the page and hit F5.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Moodle Filenames with Non-ascii Characters Running IIS 7.5 and 7
Post description: Hi everyone I struck on a problem today with file names, which contains specific danish characters (æøå). At first a thought this might be an issue with encoding, however the problem lies outside Moodle. After having debugging I found that the function ressource_pluginfile contains a varible called args, wich gets the filename in the URI. If running an IIS with Fast CGI any non ascii characters will be cut of, which will result in Moodle not being able to return the file to the user (file not found error). Microsoft has issue a hotfix for this error, which can be found at following URLs: IIS 7.5 : http://support.microsoft.com/kb/2277918/ IIS 7.0 : http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?displaylang=en&FamilyID=c17a72bd-7009-4830-85e0-06290f3b8367 More information about this issue can be seen at http://www.redolivedesign.com/utah-web-designers-blog/2010/10/18/how-to-fix-utf-8charset-problem-with-iis-7-5-and-php-fastcgi/ I hope this post will help others fix the issue, without going through hours of debugging. Best regards /Henrik

Post description: I have installed the ResourcePage Module and patched the relevant files as per README, all the tables have been created correctly etc.. ResourcePage appears in the Resourec menu and when selected I get what appears to be a fully functioning "Add ing a new ResourcePage " form. When trying to save changes (" save and display" or " save and return to course ") I get a " Could not add a new instance of ResourcePage " error. I have checked the database and the mdl_resourcepage table is being written to with the info I'm filling in on the form. I am testing using an Xammp package of 1.9 beta4. Hope someone can help as I really like the look of this new module tia Joe
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, thanks for trying it. Unfortunately, as noted on the download page for resourcepage, it currently requires the Postgres database, not MySQL . This might cause these problems (and others if you get past that stage). Database table creation is all done using the Moodle cross-platform system but some of the queries use Postgres-specific features (well, mostly SQL standard features, but whatever) that are not supported in MySQL. I have edited the description to make this clearer. It's in bold now! And in a clear list. (Before it was just one sentence towards the end in normal type, so it was a bit easy to miss.) We are hoping to enhance resourcepages to also support MySQL, perhaps in the next few months (I can't promise a date! or even that we actually get it done. but it looks hopeful). If using Postgres is not an option for you, then maybe you can try again then. Apologies for the inconvenience. --sam
Comment 2: Hi Sam Thanks for replying. It's a real shame, I guess the majority of Moodlers use MySQL. I had a quick look and I don't think Postgres would be easy for us to transfer to. (Has anyone out there transfered from MySQL to Postgres???? Is there major benefits in transfering?) How much work do you estimate there is in making ResourcePage MySQL compatible? Many thanks again Joe
Comment 3: I wish this was in MySql too, we really need a module like this but can't use Postgres
Comment 4: The problem is a few of the SQL statements in the code. Fixing it would involve searching all the resourcepage code for "->do_sql", and checking that the SQL there works in MySQL. There will only be a few that are a problem (unfortunately they will be the most complex), and the first task is to identify them, then the second task is to rewrite them in a database-independent way.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Still problems with NLN materials and IMS CP
Post description: I posted an earlier topic in hope of some help with getting NLN Materials to run through the new IMS CP on version 1.6. Thank you for the replies I did get, but I'm kind of left in limbo here as there seems to be no actual answer to why the materials won't install or show up. I can unpack them manually into the right folders, and even select the unpacked items from a list that I'm given when trying to add an IMS. But that's it, they just don't show up on the page when previewed or run? Has anyone out there actually managed to get NLN Materials running on version 1.6 without some form of black magic? If so, PLEASE could you give me a few pointers on what to do.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I have not succeeded with the IMS Repostitory. But I can run NLN materials under the SCORM activity. I tried to change my imr-repostiory folder to properties 777 but failed always returning to 755. I  am runnig Apache on top of  Windows 2003 server All I did was upload the zip file into the files area for the course  without unzipping it and then adding the SCORM activity pointing to the ZIP file. I note that Helen has stated that the latest OBJECT module which can be downloaded from Moodle.org works with version 1.6 That acted as a central repostiory in version 1.5 and was easy to use. I may well return to using OBJECT. Nick
Comment 2: Thanks for your reply Nick. I'll try out both options and see if I can work with them. I'd really like to get these things working as I seem to be under increasing pressure from management to prove Moodle as the VLE to use, rather than go for Microsoft Learning Gateway. I will add I'm also using Windows 2003 server and I have no end of permission problems with folders. You change them one minute and the next minute they're back to read only. I really wish I could have a Linux machine to run Moodle on.
Comment 3: Hello <? xml :namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" />Duncan<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /> We are also using  Microsoft SharePoint portal as a resource repository which we will continue to develop. The  staff and students get their own site with Portal so that they can upload/ download work to/from home. In addition each course has its own SharePoint site.  It  has a typical Microsoft front end which makes it easier for people to use. ( familiarity) Last year we also trialled Class Server which we are not renewing.  With its licensing it is quite expensive.   Not only that but  for what we need, Moodle does a better job. In particular I am a major fan of the Moodle quiz and the Hot Potato modules which I have used seriously with my students with good results.
Comment 4: Hi Nick, That's interesting as I've not heard a great deal of information about Microsoft Learning Gateway and how it compares to Moodle. You just get the marketing hype and that's it from Microsoft. Off track there for a moment. Until the IMS CP part of release 1.6 is sorted out, I'd suggest to anyone, as you did, to use the Object module from Moodles site. I installed it and miracle of miracles I can now use the NLN Materials with great ease. Many thanks to you and everyone else who's helped out with replies in the past. The SCORM module also works, but it's not as simple as the Object one and doesn't really give me things in the form I'd prefer them.

Post title: 2.2.2+ - quicktime (mov) embed not showing but playing
Post description: Hi there, We have 2.2.2+ May 5, 2012 release and have a strange situation. I added a quicktime video file and set to have it embed in the page. When we view it, it's blank but I can hear it playing ... strange ... no download , etc...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I am having a similar issue.  It will flash on screen for a second, play audio for a while and then quit.  Are you on a Mac?  I am finding this problem on a mac with multiple browsers but it plays just fine on a PC.
Comment 2: I suggest you to re-encode quicktime (mov) to AVI format which is a streaming video format ... In addition, if you need to compress your DVD's to MOV files, check this tutorial .
Comment 3: I don't know about the person that started this but that is not a practical solution for me.  I need these to be in mp4 format - I have bypassed the issue by forcing them to download for now.
Comment 4: Hi Emma, you can download Miro Video Converter - http://www.mirovideoconverter.com/ or FormatFactory - http://www.formatoz.com/ to convert your files from .mov to .mp4 Cheers Stan
Comment 5: I have used Winff to convert anything to mp4 and find it very stable and (of course) free.
Comment 6: Thanks but my files are actually already in mp4 format but still having the same issue.
Comment 7: I am absolutely NOT an expert here but I have successfully added video that seems to run on just about anything.  I only use MP4's to embed and have had no problem since changing to this format. It seems the most compact and universal format for all systems. It will also (of course download to iPods, iPhones and iPad)

Forum Post: 
Post title: Java and Text files
Post description: Hi, I have a faculty member who has uploaded a .txt file with java code in it. The problem is each time the students click on the file to download it, it pops up in a new window. When you right click on it and save it as text, it loses the formatting or adds some weird html code around it. She wants the students to be able to download it in it original format as a simple .txt so the student can use the code for compiling.  I have tried it in I.E. Firefox and Safari. All do something similar. Any suggestions would be helpful. Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, Lauren, Just off the top of my head, putting the text file inside a textarea or an an iframe might quickly and easily solve the problem. Might not be the most elegant solution, but could/should work. Someone else will probably have a better solution, though. -- Art
Comment 2: Hi, We have the same problem in france... In "Administration » Configuration » Filters" set "Filter uploaded files:" to "no" and then it's OK. Kevin
Comment 3: Fantastic! Thanks for the information. Lauren

Post description: Sorry if this a duplicate, but I am trying to use folders to group links of similar URLs. Do any of you have a quick answer for how to do this using the folder resource?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Michelle. Just wondering why it needs to be folders - is it for aesthetic reasons? I can only really think of using the page resource. Folders are more for files and would make it difficult easily to click on the URL to access the website.
Comment 2: Hi Mary It’s possible to add url in folder? Some teacher need to have url link and files together in folder. Please advice.
Comment 3: Was this ever actioned in the end? I really need to be able to do this too, and can't see a reason why it wouldn't be possible. A page is too much of a 'single entity', whereas I want to link off to *different files* (= URLs) -- they just happen to be situated on other websites.
Comment 4: Me too. And on top of that, pages cannot be put in a folder too. My problem is that I need to group student access to learning materials, and this is best done with folders. But I cannot put URLs in the folder, nor pages. Any solutions?
Comment 5: Have a look at the Open University's sub-page module : https://github.com/moodleou/moodle-mod_subpage and here is an old video from a couple of years back showing it in action http://www.moodleblog.net/2012/01/14/sub-page-module-yet-another-way-to-avoid-the-moodle-scroll-of-death/
Comment 6: Hi To put URLs into a folder: Create a shortcut on your desktop to the URL (Windows) - not sure if this could be done with a Mac. (Right click on your desktop then 'add new shortcut') Then drag and drop the shortcut into the folder. Adding an internal Moodle page to a folder: Presumably if one creates a shortcut to the page internal link, the one could drop that in as well. Hope this helps, although long after the original query!
Comment 7: Hi Brenda, This adds a text file to the folder that does not open the link. Rgrds, Paul.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Cannot open files higher that 1 MB
Post description: Hello, I am using moodle 1.9.3 (Build: 20081204) and after making the upload of some files to resources, I cannot open PDF, XLS, PPT, WORD, ZIP, etc files that have more than 1 MB. I can make the download , but when I try to open, the files are corrupted. If the file have less than 1MB I can open without any problem. If i make a link to a URL with this files, I do not have a problem. My config.php and theme config.php do not have any space or line after the last tag. What could be the problem? Thank you Miguel
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Miguel, you probably need to change your "Maximum Upload Size" file size settings. You can change this by clicking Settings which you should be to the left on your main screen under Administration. This will allow you to Edit Course Settings. Then scroll down until you see maximum upload file size....then simply change the file size to a much larger file. Hopefully that will solve your problem. Angie DiLillo

Forum Post: 
Post title: File Download stall outs with Snow Leopard
Post description: I thought I'd try asking the excellent Moodle community about this even though it is probably only indirectly related to Moodle but we are seeing students having issues downloading files from Moodle under the following conditions: OS: Mac OS 10.6 "Snow Leopard" Browser: Either Firefox or Safari Connection: Offsite ( a slower connection than LAN speed) Basically, any Macbooks with Snow Leopard on them have trouble downloading files (through a resources module) that are greater than 1MB if they are offsite no matter what browser they use (if they are on Campus the files come through just fine). What happens is the download starts and then gets to 1MB and just stops (stalls out). No error, no nothing. You can try to resume, etc and the same thing happens over and over again. When I look in the Apache access logs I see a successful hit on the file.php URL (200) and exactly 1MB of data sent (almost like the browser sent an ACK command saying they were done). I've checked into all of our time-out settings and nothing seems very low (in fact, the downloads hit 1MB and stop pretty quickly before a time-out could possibly be triggered it seems). The other oddity is that they can go to a non-Moodle section of our portal with a file download repository (just straight URLs, no fancy send_file calls or chunking) during the same session and those files will download flawlessly. So, it seems like it is some combo of how Moodle does file downloading and how Snow Leopard receives files. Any help would be appreciated as I have found nothing on the subject and the number of students who can't access files offsite is mounting. The specs: Moodle 1.9.3+ is running on Windows 2003 with MySQL 5.0.21, Apache 2.0.58 and PHP 5.2.3 The site is running as pure SSL and we have all files forced to download (we've had display problems in Safari and Firefox with some embedded file types).
Comments associated with the post:

Forum Post: 
Post title: Editing existing resources
Post description: We use moodle 1 mostly to organise resources so students can access them easily. Resources are mostly MS-Word documents but also MS-Excel, PDF, html etc. It takes a long time to update a resource doesn’t it! Delete existing resource. Upload new one from local machine. Very tedious. We found a way to access the files directly, which means we can edit and save them directly on the moodle server . Updates are ‘live’ as soon as the new version is saved. (Basically, we can use Windows Explorer to open the moodle server folder like any other file folder). I understand that with moodle 2 this will not be possible. I don’t think I’ll be using moodle now because it takes too long to update existing resources. If I open a file through moodle, it is always read-only – even if it’s a file I wrote and uploaded myself. Why?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: With Moodle 2.3 you have a variety of ways of editing  exisiting documents. For example upload your Word document into your Private files and then link to it in your courses. Update it just in your private files and it will automatically update elsewhere Use an external file sharing site like Box.net repository or Dropbox and again when you update in one of those, it will automatically update on your Moodle. No need to reupload. Moodle 2.3 is much better than Moodle 1 in that respect. See http://docs.moodle.org/23/en/Working_with_files#Creating_an_alias.2Fshortcut
Comment 2: Thanks, Mary. I finally got around to trying the Private files method and unfortunately it didn't work. I uploaded a ‘private file’ and connected it to a sandbox course for testing, no problem. Then I tried editing it – OK, opening the file from ‘sandbox’ makes it ‘read only’ but opening it from my list of private files let me edit it... ...or so I thought. There was a file permission error when I tried to save the amended version. “Word cannot complete the save due to a file permission error.” it said. Is this a local problem, do you think? More to the point, any idea how to solve it? Thanks Ewen
Comment 3: Double check: is there some subtle thing you are doing different to Mary?  Maybe check on demo.moodle.org first.  If it works there, it is a local problem. Are you uploading a new version to your private files?  Same name?  How are yo doing it? -Derek
Comment 4: I'll check that, thanks. What I'm doing, and what I want need to do, is simply to open a document on moodle, edit it, and save the new version.
Comment 5: Ewen: I'll leave someone else to comment on this.  I suspect INSIDE Moodle this is not possible. (ie Private files, Flie System repo etc) But in something like Dropbox, Equella, Google docs or BOX.net it is. I think I know what you want.  In the file adding screen, you just want to click on the icon and edit the file then click save. -Derek
Comment 6: Yes, that's exactly what I'd like to do, thanks Derek: once a file has been uploaded, I'd like to edit and save a new version. Uploading a new version every time is pretty tedious. Some of these files are also shared, so several teachers can edit the same document.
Comment 7: Well, this isn't working at all. What is wrong with moodle that it won't allow you to edit files? Yes, we could work-around with something like google docs (which wouldn't support some of the files we use, and besides some of the files have data we can't post online for data-protection reasons). With moodle 1 at least we could use it like a simple shared folder for files, which many staff were comfortable with. With moodle 2 there's now a gap between the clever-clever techie stuff it's been designed for, and the basic functionality that many of my colleagues need.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Mass email
Post description: How can I send message/news to all teachers only or email all students only?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: One way to do this is through forced subscription to a Forum.  For course teachers, have them subscribe to the "Teacher forum" within the course and then simply make a post of the message you want them to receive.  For students, set the "News Forum" on the course homepage to Force everyone to be subcribed?: , and then make a post as mentioned.  If your annoucement e-mail to students is for the entire site (ie, all courses), use the Site News forum on Moodle homepage and set to forced subscription.
Comment 2: Why are the developers of moodle are not an option for mass email? as it exists in the administration of phpBB forums!

Forum Post: 
Post title: Major resource error with internet explorer.
Post description: When teachers upload a .doc and link to it as a resource explorer can’t download the file and has this error message: “Internet Explorer cannot download ….file.doc from moodle.mysite.org. Internet Explorer was not able to open this Internet site. The requested site is either unavailable or cannot be found. Please try again later.” It doesn’t happen with all .doc files and it doesn’t happen in Firefox . I can force IE to download the file sometimes by right clicking->open in new window. But that doesn’t always work. I am running 1.8 (2007021505) Any help would be most appreciated!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello, We had this same issue..sigh. We identified this error and resolved by modifying the page where the download link is located and setting the download options by selecting "Same Window" and NOT "New Window" and it was like magic. Hope this helps...took us a just about all day to find this. We were able to find this by clicking on the download link and when the Save As dialog box appears, the file name had no .doc extension (it was missing and replaced with _). Regards, Dave
Comment 2: Hi all,

Post description: Moodle Version 1.9.9 Mysql IIS 6.0, Windows Server 2003 I am trying to rename the option under "Add a resource" drop down menu selection - "Display a directory" to "Display a folder" but can't find it under "Language Editing" lists. Forum Post: 
Post title: Embedding Videos 2.2
Post description: Hi, Just a quick question - we've moved from 1.9 to 2.2 and I am trying to embed a flash video. If using a youtube video, I can just copy and paste the embed code provided, that works fine - But, with flash content we had created ourselves, we used to upload the video to the files section, right click on the uploaded file, go to "copy link location" and then paste the location of the file into a manually typed in HTML Embed code in a label. In 1.9, we got a URL such as http://moodle.ac.uk/file.php/40/Hairdressing_2.swf - we'd then do something along the lines of <embed src="http://moodle.ac.uk/file.php/40/Hairdressing_2.swf" /> to paraphrase and it'd work. In 2.2, I don't seem to get this static link to the file - I have tried uploading as normal in the file picker and also uploading in my "private files" block too - the "link location" of the file doesn't seem to work. Does anyone know how I can do this?????  We have literally moved to 2.2 last week, so may be missing a useful plugin or something that may help. If I use "add a file" to add the video - or if use the "Moodle media" button at the top of the label box to add the flash file - I just get a link to it the file, which then opens in a new window, not it displayed on the main page you do when embedding it. Any help would be appreciated!!! Laura
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi there. Perhaps this  in the documentation might help - http://docs.moodle.org/23/en/Video
Comment 2: Thank you, managed to get it working by editing the multimedia filters under plugins in the admin section - although SWF was already ticked as enabled, and it was a SWF that wouldn't embed - I've now ticked them all and it works.

Post title: Removing Frame Option?
Post description: Is there a way to remove the option to "Put resource in a frame to keep site navigation visible" which appears when a user adds a resource and chooses 'in the same window'? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Or is there a way to make the checkbox by it default to unchecked rather than checked?
Comment 2: Yes, there is ( moodle 1.5.3+ ): In the file .../mod/resource/type/file/resource.class.php erase the five letters marked yellow in the following code segment (near the end of the file): 
```text
        $windowtype = ($CFG->resource_popup) ? 'popup' : 'page';
```
 
```text
        if (empty($form->options)) {
```
 
```text
            $form->options = '
frame
';
```
 
```text
            $form->reference = $CFG->resource_defaulturl;
```
 
```text
        }
```
 
```text
    }
```
 This will change the default of new file resources to "unchecked" while retaining the ability to turn the option on again. Regards, Klaus

Forum Post: 
Post title: HTML. text and link pages
Post description: I posted this in the general Forum but got no replies so I'm trying this Forum. Apologies if it contravenes the rules: I have 2 problems..... 1. I need to do a lot of linking between web pages created in Moodle. I can find the ID of the page to link to by going into the database and searching for the relevant entry but this is very long winded & slow process and the ID's don't seem to tie up with the URL 's that the generated page indicates For example I have a (HTML) resource in the database with an ID of 21 but if I try http://ibdtraining.org/moodle/mod/resource/view.php?inpopup=true&id=21 I just get a message Resource ID incorrect. Similarly a known working URL such as http://ibdtraining.org/moodle/mod/resource/view.php?inpopup=true&id=17 doesn't have a corresponding ID in the database. (It's there but with an ID of 12) Can anyone put me right on this please? 2.  Also I'm having an error saving HTML files,links or text files as Pop-ups (error message windowobj is null or not an object.) It's being generated in this function: function openpopup(url,name,options,fullscreen) { fullurl = " http://ibdtraining.org/moodle " + url; windowobj = window.open(fullurl,name,options); if (fullscreen) { windowobj.moveTo(0,0); windowobj.resizeTo(screen.availWidth,screen.availHeight); } windowobj.focus(); return false; Looking through the Forums I see that others have posted this error but there has been no reply. I'm sure I'm not thinking straight but any help would be really appreciated, just to be steered in the right direction Dave
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Any resource must be setup in a course. As a result, the 'course_module' table id is used to call the resource not the 'resource' table. The 'resource' table ids are the "instance" of the module which is included in the 'course_module' table. The best way to discover the proper URL is to launch it from within the course that was used to create it and note the address in the address bar. Simply paste this as your target from anywhere within Moodle and the course and module will be called up. The user must be enrolled in the course to view the resource. I set up a general course with unrestricted access to setup and host these types of resources. Regarding pop-ups. I use the resource setting to launch in a new window. This seems to be a very reliable way to launch resources from anywhere in Moodle in a popup window. However, the main window will navigate to the hosting course. I hope this helps. Jamie
Comment 2: Thanks Jamie: I was hoping that there was a quicker way of doing it. I've partly resolved the problem by  creating files systematically so that ID's are in sequence...saves a bit of time having to launch new pop-ups to get the ID. Thanks also for the explanation of how the database works. Dave

Post description: I've started using HTML5 output from MadCap Flare. To use this in my courses I do the following: Create a zip file of the output HTML5 folder. Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Well you could use the main menu block - with the editing turned on, add a block and choose main menu. Forum Post: 
Post title: Its possible to create a resource inside another resource ?
Post description: I Need to create the following hierarchy: My Moodle -> Course -> Main Resource -> Second Resource -> 3rd Resource So navigation bar can display the full path of a resource, its that possible ? Tks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Kirk, Jordan's just asked me to have a look at this for you, he also informs me you are using Moodle 1.9. Within Moodle it is not possible to create one resource inside another. You can add resources and activities to a course and that is it. If what you are really after is just the navigation bar then you could probably hack the build_navigation function within weblib.php to alter the navigation bar based upon the order of activities/resources within a course section, and then indent the activities/resources within the section to fake the appearance, however it would require changing core core so would probably not be a great idea. Hope this helps. Cheers Sam
Comment 2: Looks like a "possible" solution, wich is better that what i have so far, sry to ask that much, but could you show me some code for making it work ? So far all i know is that the build_navigation is on weblib.php. I allready have my resources in order and Indented when i list my course resources, how can I put this on build_navigation? Thanks
Comment 3: Hi Kirk, Presently I'm flat tack at work so can't stop to look too much into it however at a glance I would suggest trying the following. I see that build_navigation takes a $cm object and part way through the function it checks if its an object and then adds stuff to the navigation. I would think that $cm contains both the course id and section id/number which should be enough for what you need. To begin I would use the course id to retrieve the course (which is likely $COURSE) and then call $modinfo = get_fast_modinfo($course) with it to get all of the information about the resources/activities in the course. Within $modinfo you will need to locate the section that the $cm is within and then iterate through its activities/resources adding each to the $navlinks array stopping when you get to the end OR you find the activity/resource that matches $cm's instanceid. It sounds a little complex but when you plan it out it shouldn't be too bad. That being said you will probably need pretty good development skills to get through it. Sorry I can't help more at this point hopefully the above is enough to get you through, all focus is on Moodle 2.0 development presently. Cheers Sam
Comment 4: Im not familiar with moodle functions, ive got the $modinfo = get_fast_modinfo($COUSE)  but i have no idea how to iterate this getting the resources, im pretty shure that moodle have some function for that but no idea wich one...

Forum Post: 
Post title: Content Security
Post description: Hello All, I'm facing a problem regarding my course security which is running in moodle. I want to make my content secure to copy purpose , so that noone can copy my content and flash swf's. Can this is possible in moodle ??
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=67649
Comment 2: Hi Amit, The short answer is no, you can't protect your SWF files from being copied when they are displayed using Moodle. There are ways to make it more difficult but ultimately, anyone can install one of the many plugins for Firefox that'll circumvent any security measures that you introduce. Basically, Flash is inherently insecure as it's very easy to download , copy and decompile (read the Actionscript code). The only thing that I can think of, off the top of my head, is to embed your SWF files in secure PDF files. I believe that Adobe Acrobat allows you to do this from version 8 (or earlier?) onwards. The PDF would be encrypted and fairly secure but nothing's 100%! Also, don't be conned into buying SWF Actionscript encryption applications. All they are is obfuscators which only serve to make the code more difficult to read. A very simple security measure you can include is for the SWF to check the URL it's on before it runs the program. So if anyone downloads and copies to another location, it won't run. You can also configure it to show a copyright message and give a link to your website. But again, anyone can decompile your SWF and change the code.

Comment 3: Windows 2003 Server, Moodle 1.9.1+ Check your config.php file.  If it has anything above: "<?php /// Moodle Configuration File " Delete it and save config.php  Reset the security on the config.php file to not allow anything but the System or Administrators to write/modify the config.php file. Post title: You've heard I'm sure but... I need Help getting Flash to Work....
Post description: Ok - I'll admit I'm a newbie to all this and the question must be one of the most commonly asked - and the answer is probably right in front of me but.... How do I get Flash uploads to work in Moodle 1.8? I have tried just about everything that seemed obvious and the Flash file actually works find everywhere else but except inside of Moodle. The files are Powerpoints converted to SWF files. They actually run when called via a url link direct from the Moodle root directory but not from inside Moodle... Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You should be able to add a resource to link to a file or webpage. You need to click the button that states upload or choose file. You will see this if you have access to the website via FTP . Additionally a quicker way to upload the files into the directory is using an FTP. Once the files are there, you can assign (Resources) to the files. I hope this helps.

Post title: File Activity - possible to add a button when users reaches bottom of document?
Post description: Hi We currently get users to read PDFs via the file activity.  We would like to make it a bit more user friendly so that when a reader reaches the bottom of the document (currently embedded), they are prompted with some form of pop up to let me easily navigate to the next section. Can anyone help?  Is this possible? Thanks
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Ted, I used to use PDF's but switched to using Book resources for a couple of reasons. One, PDF's were much more time consuming and awkward to edit and update. Two, there was no simple way to create a link/path to another PDF, reading assignment, or directions. Using Book's had multiple advantages. I could edit, if needed, right in Moodle. I could break up long PDF's by splitting into chapters and sub-chapters. And the one you need, I could enter HTML links that would take my students directly to the next needed location in the course. Just go to the location I wanted to go to, copy the URL , go to the point in the book where I wanted to jump from, insert the URL link, then save the book. In many cases, I would have multiple links since I taught 7th and 8th graders, and depending on the grade of the student, they would need to jump to different places, sometimes.

Post title: Stopping the preview of uploaded or chosen file
Post description: Hi there. When you add a file such as a Word doc onto the course page, it always previews the item.  Is there a way to stop this?  When I am changing a lot of files, it gets annoying having to close windows and using the breadcrumbs to go back. Many thanks Neil
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This drives me nuts too, though I see why it is sometimes useful. Maybe a check box as to whether we want to preview the file or not, developers? OP , what I've been doing in the meantime is changing my browser settings to always ASK me before opening a file from a link, and then disabling popups. That way the "new window" doesn't pop up and thus the "Do you want to open or save this file?" dialog can't. In Firefox , do like this: Tools > Options > Web Features Check the top box, "Block pop up windows" Then click the "Downloads" tab and check "Ask me where to save every file"
Comment 2: Thanks, I am glad its not just me. This is certainly a feature I'd like to see added, the checkbox idea is a good one I think, maybe thats on the cards?
Comment 3: Hate to do a "me too" but... me too! The previewing feature, while well-intentioned, drives myself and most of our teachers nuts.

Post title: errors in Moodle
Post description: Hi all I am a little new to Moodle but learning fast. I am current using Moodle (I'm a teacher) in school in most classes. Having switched the hosting of the site from internal to an external hosting package. All sorts of error and stuff seems to be coming up e.g. Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 394 Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 396 Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 397 Warning: Attempt to assign property of non-object in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 397 Notice: Trying to get property of non-object in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 398
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Liam, I believe this could be a conflict with your PHP version. Can you find out what version of PHP you used in your internal system a and the version of PHP installed on your current hosting package. Also, please post the version of Moodle you are using... S.
Comment 2: The version of Moodle I am using is 1.9.9, not sure about the version of PHP but I will find out. Thanks Liam
Comment 3: I wonder what drove you to turn on debugging in the first place? What other problems are you having? How did you migrate your site over to the external hosting?
Comment 4: I hadn't realized that I have turned on the debugging. Not sure how to turn it off either. The other error I am getting is: Notice: Undefined property: stdClass::$allowuserswitchrolestheycantassign in /home2/geraldsi/public_html/lib/accesslib.php on line 4243 Not sure what is causing this either? I copied the site off our school server onto a CD and got the external hosting company to reload it onto theirs. Is this the best method?? Liam
Comment 5: I wouldn't be comfortable with such a method as you have no way of knowing what may have got lost or corrupted while passing from one format to another, and from one party to another. It would be helpful to know what version of php you are running. Can you upload files to your server? Create a file called something obscure like testfile.php (must be "something.php") and include this line: <?php info.php ?> Upload it to your webroot and then in your browser go to yourwebsite.com/testfile.php to see what version of php you are running. It is possible though that you have lost or corrupted files in transit. It the site working normally apart from these errors?
Comment 6: I can upload file to the server no problem. I had problems a few days ago uploading a csv file of users. But got that sorted. The version of PHP running on the current server is PHP 5.2.9. One problem I have noticed when using the site is in creating a new course all of those first errors come up and won't allow me add anything to the course for some reason. But the existing courses are running fine most of the time. What would you recommend to change or add??? Liam
Comment 7: There shouldn't be any conflict with your version of Moodle and the version of PHP you are using. It's really difficult to say not knowing what may have happened during the migration. Your system may be suffering from multiple issues here, Is it possible that these errors exited before but you had error reporting set differently? Do you have access to the last working instance of the site? Do you have the CD with the code you gave to your hosting company? For what it is worth, what I would do is: try to install a copy of the original site on my local computer (I use xampp on Mac and Windows for this) Set error reporting to full power (Site Administration > Server > Debugging > DEVELOPER) This way you get maximum error reporting. See what you get Download the latest version of Moodle and update your local version (remember to include all your 3rd-party module with the upgrade - refer to google docs for more help on upgrading) One other thing: check that you have sufficient server memory allocated for your installation.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Subtitles aren't available in Youtube URL resouce
Post description: I have added a YouTube link with URL resource in my lesson . Despite subtitles are available in the youtube, when I view the video from my course there is none option to select a subtitle. Is there a solution to that?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hello John, Solution 1 I don't think the control bar provided by Moodle has a button to toggle subtitles on and off. However, subtitles can be displayed by default. Here's how: Go to Youtube. Edit your video. At the bottom of the "Video Details" page, click "VIEW MORE". In the "Add tag" box, add "yt:cc=on". Save your video. The subtitles will then be displayed in the video. Note that it takes a few seconds before the control bar fades away and the subtitles become clearly visible. Solution 2 Otherwise, users can open the video in YouTube by simply clicking in the upper part of the video. In YouTube, the control bar includes a button to enable and disable subtitles.
Comment 2: Thanks for the info!
Comment 3: Thanks so much for this! Solution 1 worked for me.
Comment 4: Click Settings . From the left-hand menu, click Playback and performance. Check or uncheck Always show captions. Check or uncheck Include auto-generated captions (when available). ______________________________________________________________________________________ See: https://subdl.live/

Forum Post: 
Post title: Backups del sitio
Post description: Alguien podría explicarnos cómo automatizar la realización de backups del sitio donde esté alojado Moodle? Hemos intentado bajar el fichero moodle-cron-for-windows.zip , que teóricamente está en http://moodle.org/download/modules/moodle-cron-for-windows.zip pero lo han eliminado
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Creo que es mejor tomar responsabilidad por los backups como administrador y no utilizar las capacidades por dentro de Moodle para hacer lo mismo. Asi, recomiendo pensar del proceso de hacer un backup como la Santa Trinidad (tres partes distintas en uno) que uno se debe practicar religiosamente (por lo menos diaramente). Las partes consisten en 1) un backup del base de archivos utilizando una herramienta como MySQL Admin para exportar los datos a un archivo de formato SQL 2) hacer una copia de todos los archivos en la carpeta de MoodleData y 3) ultimamente, hacer una copia de los archivos que consisten su instalación de Moodle, quiere decir el código (especialmente el archivo config.php). Con los archivos de MoodleData, despues de archivar todos los archivos me parece aceptable hacer un backup parcial de solo los archivos que han cambiado pero cada semana haria otro backup completo. Al respeto del número 3 es importante si uno ha aplicado cambios especializados para su sitio. Si se usa del programa como es pues siempre es posible bajarlo de nuevo del internet. Con estes tres pedazitos, se puede reconstruir su sitio. Espero que este responde a la pregunta y no le ha dejado con mas preguntas. Suerte y feliz Moodle-ando - Antonio

Post title: Problems locating style that is applying background-color
Post description: I am having trouble applying a background color to a HTML resource page.  For some reason, there is a grey background. I want this to be white. I've looked through the stylesheets, but cannot seem to find the id that is applying this grey color. If it helps, here is some of the id's found in the source of the page. Main Page Body Tag <body  class="mod-resource course-7 editing" id="mod-resource-view"> Start of the Content: <div id="content"> <table align="center"   class="generalbox" border="0" cellpadding="20" cellspacing="0"> Any ideas on where I should be looking for the id that is making the grey background?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Glenn, It was good to see you again at this year's MADLaT conference. Here's the link to CSS inspector I use when doing Moodle Themes : http://www.moddular.org/log/css-inspector/ . It's very helpful. Jody.
Comment 2: Hi Glen, When you say "a HTML resource page" do you mean (1) an HTML page composed on your computer using e.g. a web page editor, then uploaded to "my files" directory on your Moodle site, OR (2) an HTML page composed directly on the Moodle platform, inserted using the drop-down box "Add a Resource" -> "Compose a Web page"? Which theme are you using? a standard Moodle theme? out of the box or customized? In case you mean (2) above, you can add the following to one of your current theme's CSS files: 
```text
.mod-resource #page #content .generalbox {


  background-color: #FFFFFF; /* = white */


}
```
 Hope this helps, Joseph
Comment 3: Joseph, I am using a custom theme called college15 from the website: http://www.ballisticlearning.biz/moodlethemes/ . I added a resource and "composed a Web page".  I placed your code: .mod-resource #page #content .generalbox { background-color: #FFFFFF; /* = white */ } at the bottom of my styles_color.css file and I still can't get it to work.  I don't know much about the code, so do I need to replace anything such as #page with something specific?  Does this line need to be in a particular spot in the file? Thank you for your time. Glen
Comment 4: Joseph, The matter has been resolved by placing the code in both the standard and the custom .css files.  It now displays correctly for Firefox but not IE .  I plan to optimize Moodle for Firefox only, so I have no plans to follow up on IE.  Thanks for your help. Glen

Forum Post: 
Post title: Sharing resources
Post description: Hello all As I've stated in a previous post, I'm creating online photography courses. I've gotten the resources in place, the auto linking works, etc, but I have one problem. I can't share the resources with other courses!!! They are in a folder outside of the public_html, so I can't link to it. I've tried place them into the FILES folder in my moodle folder, but then everyone can access the files(not possible when it's outisde of public_html), plus the autolinking doesn't seem to work. Do I assume that I'll have to duplicate the entire resource folder for each new courses that I want to add?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Noel, If your system is LINUX, the best way to achieve your goal is to create a symbolic link from your external resource repository to the individual folder id for the course accessing the resources.
Comment 2: how do I do that? Is it possible to link to my moodledata folder which is outside of my public_html? Noel
Comment 3: Noel - Have you tried using the "Glossary" tool to create an image database ? If you create a glossary and flag it as "global" then it's available to all courses. Additionally, if you set the glossary type to "Encyclopedia", then when you create glossary entries with images as attachments, they are automatically displayed inline, so it becomes a very neat images database with keyword searching, autolinking, and other nice features.
Comment 4: If you create a glossary and flag it as "global" then it's available to all courses That's what I thought as well and IMO that's how it should be. But especially if you are including pictures this doesn't work. It's like Dan said in his other post: file.php handles permissions very strictly and as such if you are not enrolled in the course to which the glossary belongs (even if it's a global one), you will not have access to the pictures in it: they will not display. I agree with Dan that hacking file.php to take away some of the security is a dangerous thing. But how about this: file.php checks if you are logged in (course doesn't matter) file.php only serves images / no other filetypes file.php only serves images that are inside a directory called `public` or `sitewide` to make sure no teacher puts files in there which should be available to students of a particular course only.
Comment 5: P.S. Try not to violate Moodle's security by fiddling around with symbolic links directly to the moodledata folder! The reason for putting the moodledata folder outside the public_html directory is because the folder is readable/writeable by the server, and therefore if it was remotely accessible there is a security risk. Moodle handles access security through things like file.php which checks authorisation before sending out files taken from the moodledata folder.
Comment 6: Is there anyway to change FILE.PHP to check if a person is logged in, though not in the course that I want to share from? I can see how I can take out the check if their logged in in FILE.PHP, but I want to restrict access to students

Post title: .flv resource revisited
Post description: Let me try explaining this again: We are upgrading from Moodle 1.9 to 2.1.  Many courses have .flv resource links.  These links to not work after the upgrade.  Moodle seens not to know what to do with them. If I edit them through the browser and put something in the Intro field and change them from popup to automatic they work fine.  I can make these changes to the mdl_resource table behind the scenes with 1 simple SQL command, but I still need to edit the resource (just open and save it) to make the resource link work. Is there any way to touch some table behind the scenes so course owners do not have to do this final hand edit of all there .flv links. Thanks a lot...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This may not help much. I set up my first Moodle with 2.0 and had problems because my videos were class length. I had to load them directly into the foldler on the server via the backend. Apparently the answer is that 2.0 and higher uses a different file structure to store the vid files. They are not stored in the folder where they used to be. Therefore, when Moodle goes to find the video...they are in the "wrong" place. Thus, your popup is looking in the wrong place. You either have to get your files in the right place and/or direct your popup to the right folder. I hope that points you in the right direction. Dan
Comment 2: Yeah, my problem isn't knowing where the .flv files are.  Moodle knows where they are.  All I have to do is tweek the record for the link - add the missing intro text and set the type to automatic, and it works great.  My problem is automating this task so that course administrators don't have to do a simple GUI edit task over and over again after the upgrade. By the way, it's not just the video files that are stored differently under 2.0+ - all files are stored in a proprietary setup.  The former moodledata directories corresponding to the course ids are all empty.  It has moved to prorpietary files in the filedata directory.  Now everything must be accessed through the database and/or program code.  I think the developers did this in an attempt to improve overall data integrity. : ) Chris

Forum Post: 
Post title: String for "Resources" in the breadcrumbs?
Post description: Hi, where does Moodle (>= 1.8.2) get the string which is displayed in the breadcrumbs for what it calls "resources"? It doesn't seem to take it from the moodle.php lang file. Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Ok, I got it myself. The strings in the breadcrumbs are the module names . So they are not taken from the "moodle.php" lang file, but from the "resource.php" lang file! (Changing the "resource" and "resources" string in moodle.php isn't what helps.) Should anyone else drop to the same question sometime, here a short " howto ": Prerequisite: The web server process (apache or whatever) must have write permission to this file on the server Login as admin Goto >Administration >Language >Language editing Choose in the dropdown menu "Current language" the language for which you want to change the string Click on "Edit Strings" Choose the "resource.php" lang file Search the variables "modulename" and "modulenameplural" in the displayed variables of the file Change in the field at the right the string to whatever you want to Don't forget to click "Save changes: resource.php"

Forum Post: 
Post title: linking a Flash .swf file in a web page Resource
Post description: Linking to a Flash .swf file in Resources works fine. So does linking to an html page with a Flash .swf file embedded. The movie appears with its controls. However, if I embed a Flash .swf file in a webpage created as a Resource in Moodle, I lose the controls for the movie. The console just does not appear and the movie autoplays. I've copied various codes for this and none of them work. Has anyone had this problem? I'd appreciate help. Our Moodle version is 1.7 Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This might be bug MDL-9018 , which was fixed in 1.7.2.
Comment 2: Thanks John Over the weekend we upgraded to Moodle 1.82 and now the .swf files won't work at all, not embedded, not as a direct link and not in an external web page! Any help is welcome.
Comment 3: Did you enable swf in the multimedia plugin settings? Site administration -> modules -> filters -> Multimedia plugins -> Enable swf = yes
Comment 4: Yes, we did. The .swf files don't work! Is this a bug? We have Moodle version 1.8.2
Comment 5: Check the links to the swf's. Are they correct? If you paste one of these links into your browser address bar, what happens?
Comment 6: Works fine. Movie plays. All controls showing.
Comment 7: When you view the page source for one of these pages, do you see an embedded movie player (starts with an <object> tag)? If not, it would indicate that the media filter isn't working properly.
Comment 8: can't seem to view source code of the actual show as when I open it it opens full screen, might be because uploaded file is saved as .pps?
Comment 9: There is no multimedia plugin for pps. You must export it as swf.
Comment 10: I wonder if this issues is in any way related to the one I raised in my post yesterday - 'playing MP3 files from within uploaded htm webpages'. It seems to be the opposite in a way but both seem to involve the file somehow not connecting with the multimedia filter. Perhaps someone who understands how it all works could connect the two problems? Helen

Post title: Change the default pdf files drag & drop into PDF.js files
Post description: ```text
In Moodle 2.9 platform, we use the 
https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_pdfjsfolder
 Module

In the course home page , if a file with a .pdf extension is added by using the " drag and drop" , create a pdfjsfolder resource in the section in which we do drag and drop.
The title of the resource will be the name of the PDF file.
We must create a resource for each added PDF.

If the file has another extension, other than .pdf , add the file as the default mode of Moodle.

If possible, add these modifications in a custom plugin in / local
```

Forum Post: 
Post title: Add a setting for a label resource to be collapsable
Post description: There is a contributed resource type named 'Label Collapsed' ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=190563 ). It enables to create label that can be expanded and collapsed on the page. This feature has been appreciated by a number of users, so I thought it might be worth to integrate this functionality in to a standard Label resource as an option within settings. Therefore, I would like to see what do others think about that. I am thinking of spending some time on that and would like to check if it would be worth it. I have opened an issue on tracker in advance: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43336
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I think anything that has the potential to clean up the page is promising.  As long as it is just an option - I think that most of us promote the label as a way to post information that we want students to be aware of and would not want them missing it because it was minimized.
Comment 2: I think this would be ok with most people, but I think they would probably desire there to be a dropdown box that you chose one of these three options from: Standard (Non-Collapsible)  {This item would never have a +/- } Collapsible, initially Expanded {This item would have a +/- } Collapsible, initially Collapsed {This item would have a +/- } As Emma mentioned, I put some important stuff in labels that I don't want there to even be a way to collapse it and somehow the student miss it (or use the collapsibility as an excuse). Also while discussing labels, I would also REALLY like labels and item descriptions that show on the main page to be editable on the mainpage!  This seems in the spirit of allowing us to rename resources and activities directly on the main page.
Comment 3: As Emma mentioned, I put some important stuff in labels that I don't want there to even be a way to collapse it and somehow the student miss it (or use the collapsibility as an excuse). But then you would be able to choose something like 'collapsable: false' within the settings, wouldn't you? The resource already exists, the thing I propose is to merge the functionality with the original Label resource with no harm to users. I agree that inline editing would be great.
Comment 4: Hi, I have now created a patch implementing this feature and submitted it to Moodle Tracker ( https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43336 ). Please feel free to take a look if you want to!
Comment 5: It seems that this feature didn't catch any attention of anyone, though it is a really handy one. Maybe it I update this thread, someone will notice.
Comment 6: Hi Pavel, Does the original contrib code still work? We have version 2.3. Thanks, Anu
Comment 7: You can use the original (slightly modified) code on 2.3. It should work fine. https://github.com/dsv-su/moodle-mod_labelcollapsed Also, I am currently trying to push it to the Moodle Core as an add-on to Label resource, feel free to check it out: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-43336

Post title: Passing URL variable to Google Form
Post description: I added a URL to a course page and want the user's name to pass to the form when the URL is clicked. How do your determine the form field in Google Forms? Is it entry_0, entry_1, etc.? I need to signify the parameter.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Solution: you need to find out what the Google Form Field ID's are. To do that, choose pre-filled responses and examine the link so you can find out what the field ID in the Google Form is. They're something like "entry.3432423." Take those and use them in the &parameter=variable section in Moodle URL.

Post description: I have a php file that combines html and a php api curl request to pull a list of recordings from an external website. The php file is working correctly and doing what I want it to do. Due to it being php, I cannot just copy the code into an html block (which is what I would really like do) as it breaks the script. So, I placed the file in the moodle folder on the server and then linked an iframe to it.  This worked but the file is now accessible to the outside world which I cannot allow.  I tried uploading the file to moodle as a resource and as a url but then it will not display as a webpage as it should. My file structure is: html head which includes some css styling. php json curl request is then embedded in the html body tags. no footer or anything so at end of php section just closing tags for php and html body. I tried playing around with requiring config.php and is logged in at the beginning of the php section but that broke the php scripting. Would appreciate any help.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Extreme slowness with Folders.
Post description: We have a situation. In this moodle, teachers are uploading their weekly lesson plans into a folder resource type. At this point, with a year's worth of uploads (say, 7 teachers, with sub-folders for each class) the time to usability after clicking on 'edit' is 7 minutes. During this time, the whole system bogs down. I don't get a slow query from this activity- the actual query is under a second. We are working to force them to switch to another method of doing this- most probably databases- but this behavior is so bizarre, I want to see what I can do to make sure it works properly. Thanks very much!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Too little information, david. Version?  Locally hosted?  Looked at debugging? Is it a function of how many files are in the folders? -Derek
Comment 2: They're at 2.6.1+, hosted on Ubuntu LTS 12 with 6 gig of ram on a VM . VM server has juice, and there's never been any real slowdown before, with or without opcode caching. Have not turned on debugging since it's all working, albeit slow. Did check slow logs and saw nothing. As for size, I didn't post any specifics because quite frankly I just wanted to see if anybody had had *any* weird things with folders. I haven't. This folder though has, say, 5 sub folders, and those have between 2 & 3; they will have probably 10 files per terminal folder or so. Let's just say 5 teachers, 10 files per class, with 3 class preps each means 150 files total. The total zip of all files was under 3 megs, I do know that. I'll post some specifics later today. thanks For reading. The kids gotta play in the snow first…
Comment 3: On the course level, only the resource info is displayed, so the actual content of folders (files and subfolders) should have no bearing on performance. It might be worth checking the server logs (with debugging cranked up) and whether this has any relation to the theme and/or course format used.

Post title: Using Multiple Text Boxes as a Store of Information?
Post description: Hi everyone. Just wondering if there is anyway I can get this type of function within my course. I'm anticipating that the solution will involve a mix of html coding and using existing/new tools within moodle that I'm not aware of The issue surrounds having a series of text boxes on a single web page. The format on the page should be question --> text box;; question --> text box;; question --> text box etc. I'd like the student to be able to be able to save what they have written in the text boxes then have the following options: - Edit their text - Convert page to a print-friendly version Their answers in the text boxes would be stored there for them and wouldn't be graded - which makes me think that some kind of basic e-portfolio plug-in might help. There is something that looks similar to what I want on moodle (Activity --> Assignments - Online text) but this only allows 1 question on the web page and would also be graded. Any help would be grand! Thanks

Post title: WebMail in Moodle?
Post description: Is moodle planns to include webmail module or something like mail...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Has there been any more information regarding this users issue?
Comment 2: Genner - You may want to search the Modules and Plugins database . There are several mail like options. Quickmail seemed to be pretty popular and tested and revised in a second separate version for some larger installations by Wen. Feel free to check out which one best looks like it might suit your needs and let me know if you have any questions. Peace - Anthony
Comment 3: Hi Anthony, Quickmail as a sticky block loses its functionality when I try adding it as a sticky block. It does not display the Compose or History link. But when added to each individual course separately it works fine. I have installed Moodle 1.9.4. But it did not fix the problem. I have over 200 courses. Do you know if other institute use internal email in Moodle other than quickmail? I have downloaded the email block installed it and found it has great features in it, but still hesitant to apply it yet. Hana
Comment 4: Hana - Let's see if we can get that issue fixed. I am going to see if I can find someone more familiar with webmail to comment. I think quickmail would be your best bet so let's work to file an issue in the tracker and get it fixed. Peace - Anthony
Comment 5: Hi Hana: You might find "quickmail for large classes" (aka quickmail v2) lightweighted and super fast. We use it (and developed) here at SFSU. I'm not that familiar with the sticky block feature so I will have to test it out with quickmail v2. I'm hoping that somehow I could find some time to finish my quickmail v2 enhancement project so that it would be fully compatible with the new 1.9 and 2.0 codebases. Currently it should work with 1.9.x codes with minor known issues (such as we intentionally disabled the GROUP support in v2). Hope this helps! Cheers!
Comment 6: Hi Hanaa! We use the eMail Block , sometimes called eMail List. As you probably know, there aren't a lot of options out there for Moodle internal mail. For us, it was between the eMail block and Quickmail. I can't specifically remember why eMail List won out, but we've had no problems with it. The folder and contacts organization and functions are not as user-friendly as I would like, but that it from an Admin point of few. For teachers and students with only a handfull of courses, I'm sure its much easier to work with.
Comment 7: Hi Sharon; Thank you for getting back to me; I have installed Email in my personal machine and I am starting to like it. Do you know which is more popular Quickmail or Email? We are currently using Quickmail but there might be a potential off switching to Email, we will see how things, go. Thanks for the en-utf8 language pack and the hint regarding changing tags. Regards, Hanaa.
Comment 8: You're quiet welcome! I don't have anything to really base this on, but I think Quickmail is more popular - at least you hear it mentioned more often. I haven't used Quickmail (I wished I could remember why I decided against - a version compatibility issue, a function?). Anyway - how do you think it compares to eMail thus far. I think I will mention an integrated, more functional email componant as one of the project ideas Martin asked everyone to generate.
Comment 9: An internal mail feature would be great! Our institution does not require users to have an external email and we would like to contain all email communication within the system, while still retaining the email qualities (ie sent to groups, attachments, archive by folder or some similar organization mention, etc) So far I have been unsuccessful in finding a plug in or core moodle tool that achieves all this without requiring an enabled user email.
